11111.content: You wake up one day to find that something is very very different. You poke your head out from the covers and look around. Wait. Somethings wrong. Your vision is all black and white! You scratch your head. Ah! Something else is wrong! You don't have hands! Just paws! You leap out of your bed and crash on the floor. You try to stand but find that you can only stand on four paws. You look and see that you also have a very bushy tail. You have somehow become a collie! You scream, but it only comes as a bark. You begin to run around and around and around in circles of confusion. Then eventually you stop circling and sit down on the ground, panting. What do you do now?

111121121.content:
"Time for a Walk!"

With that both you and your sister are hooked up to a couple of red leashes that she bought for the project. After walking for about five minutes, you realize you have to pee, but you have no idea how you're supposed to let your mom know. After about five more minutes you find yourself close to a tree, so you run over to it to relieve yourself. Your mom seems to understand why you ran to the tree and says "Go ahead." After relieving yourself, you continue on your walk wondering just what will happen during this week. Eventually you reach the end of your walk with mom and your sister and mom removes both your leashes. "Time for bed!" With that you start to head for your room. Just as you're about to get up on your bed your mom stops you. "Nick since you're a dog now you have to sleep in this dog bed! You can still sleep in your room but stay off your bed! It's really hard to get the fur off that thing!" You're rather annoyed at not being able to sleep in your own bed, but you remind yourself that this is only for a week. With that you drift off to sleep dreaming about what you'll do tomorrow.

You wake up the very next day only to find you were back to your old self. It was a Saturday. There was no school. You rush down to see your family. Your sister is back to normal and you ask Mom about the experiment.She looks at you as if you were mad.

choices: It doesn't work (You're still a dog!)
1111211212.content: After spending the entire week as a dog, you found that being a dog wasn't too bad. There was a lot you could get away with, the dog food tasted great! The best part was that you didn't have any specific schedule. You could get up whenever you wanted, you could get your mom to take you on a walk any time she wasn't too busy, and you even got to scare off an old school bully who was trying to egg your house while your mom was away yesterday. You feel that you're going to miss being a dog and wonder if you could ask your mom if she could arrange for you to become a dog once every year for a week of the summer. Your mom walks in the door and says "Kids, come in here! I have the reversal formula!" You and your sister rush into the room where your mom is. She had you put some clothes on (which felt kind of ridiculous considering you were both currently dogs, but then again you were about to revert to being humans so it made sense.) She puts the formula in your water bowels so you can have one last drink as a dog before you return to normal. Your sister was the first to take a drink. You watched as she slowly started losing fur, her tail disappeared, she gradually got up on two feet again and eventually she was back to being 100% human. You take one last look around the room and then drink up your own bowl of water.
1111211212.title: The end of the week.

11112112121.content:

It turns out that Dad threw it away and there is no way to become a dog again because it takes a full year to create the formula again. THE END!!!!
P.S if i'm being rude very sorry ok ? =(

choices: "A cure formula can be made, but it'll take three months to complete."

11112112122.content: You wait, and you wait, but nothing seems to happen. You're still incapable of standing on two feet, you're still covered in fur, you've still got a tail, and you still have the senses of a dog. You're mom has a puzzled look on her face. "Why isn't this working? You should be human again by now." Your mom goes to review the notes and finds something rather unsettling. "Oh no! The labrador formula was stronger than the other ones we made! The reversal formula can't change you back Nick!" You begin to panic, you know that you felt like you'd miss being a dog, and would have liked to possibly be a dog again in the future for another week or two, but being a dog for the rest of your life was not what you had in mind! "Mom is Nick going to be a dog forever?" Your sister asks. Forever, the thought of being a dog for the rest of your life is overwhelming. You had human friends that you visited whenever you could, you had stuff that you just couldn't enjoy if you were a dog. You wouldn't be able play your video games, you wouldn't be able to eat some of your favorite foods (because stuff in them didn't exactly agree with dogs). Sure dogs have toys and can get away with plenty of things no person could, but when it comes down to it, people have more advantages in life than dogs ever will. "I'm going to the lab to see if this formula can be reversed, Suzie!(your sister) Make sure the door stays locked and don't open it for anyone!" After that she leaves. You're sister sits there petting you trying to comfort you as best she can. "Don't worry Nick, if you have to be a dog forever you can sleep in my room anytime you want company, I'll give you parts of my dinner if you want them." You appreciated her trying to comfort you but it honestly wasn't doing you much good at this point. After what felt like an eternity your mom finally returned home. She said that
11112112122.title: It doesn't work (You're still a dog!)

111121121221.content:
Mom: A cure formula can be made, but it'll take three months to complete.

Nick let out a sigh of relief that he won't be stuck this way forever. Since he was still going to be a dog for three more months, Suzie said she would do his homework for him. Luckily, she was in the same class. He could see that look in her eyes that told him she truly cared about him.

(9:30 p.m.)

Suzie: Okay, Nick! Time for bed!

Nick crawled into the room and lay down in the corner. Suzie gave him a smile and turned off the light.

(Travis, your ultra annoying younger brother's, POV)

Travis came home at midnight. He was at camp for a couple of weeks and, not wanting to make noise while everyone was sleeping, he tiptoed upstairs and unpacked. When he was done, he went downstairs to grab a glass of water while he played on his Playstation 3. When he got to the kitchen, he saw a vial with a dog picture on it. He read the label. "Drink to turn into a dog. Extremely dangerous, keep out of reach of children." Intresting... he could finally get revenge on the two who ruined his life! He walked up the stairs, tiptoed through the hallway, quietly creaked the door open, ran over to his sister, and saw that his older brother had been already been turned into a dog. Excellent. That saves him the trouble of sneaking into his room as well. So he poured the formula into his Suzie's mouth, she subconsciously swallowed it, and the changes started almost immediately. Quietly, he snuck out of the room, and ran down the kitchen to destroy the other vial which had the reversal formula. He silently put on some gloves to destroy the vial. His dad was a detective, and he would be able to detect fingerprints. He even turned the garage into his crime lab. Also, Travis didn't want's cut up his hand, thus crushing two birds with one stone. So, he held the vial tight in his hands, and shattered it. His plan was complete.

(Suzie's POV)

After having a dreadful nightmare, which I will not describe, Suzie woke up and noticed that her hands had turned into paws, her tail had grown back, and her hair, or fur, was longer! Unless she was dreaming in a dream, she had turned into a dog! She then noticed something. Travis always left a card with a shell on it. That's how she knew Travis did this to her. Not knowing what to do, she woke up Nick.

(Nick's POV)

Nick opened up his eyes to see a dog standing in front of him, which he immediately recognized as his sister. Nick thought she had turned human again. So why was she a dog? Then he saw that look of worry in her eyes.

Nick: Suzie? Why have you turned back into a dog?

Suzie: I'm guessing Travis did it. I found his card in here.

Nick: Travis? I thought he was at camp. He shouldn't be back for another week.

Suzie: I don't know why, but I... just know he's the one who did this. And if I had to take a guess, I'd say he also destroyed the reversal formula.

Nick: I... I'm sorry...

Suzie: It's not your fault.

Nick: Yes, it is. If I hadn't--

Suzie: You did nothing wrong. I should have been more careful.

Nick: I'm still sorry that this happened.

After talking some more about the incident, the finally went to sleep. Only to be woken up by an alarm clock thirty minutes later.

111121121221121.content:
Mom: Bark if I'm reading this right. "Travis... destroyed the reversal formula... and he made... Suzie drink it."

Both dogs barked together. They could see their Mom's anger building, their relief suddenly turning into fear as Mom grabbed a dog crate and stormed off to Travis's room.

When it was all said and done, only a brown Chihuahua stood where Travis once was.

Mom: For your crimes against this household, you shall remain as a dog... FOREVER!!!

Mom: Travis will be taken to an old friend of mine, where he will live as a dog for the rest of time. That is his punishment.

The two dogs briefly looked at each other. Each one realized how great the other suddenly looked.

Suzie:He's actually kinda...

11112212.content:
You sit still, anxiously waiting to see your best friend face. As the voice gets closer, you become more excited as your tail thumps up and down. You expect to see your friend, of course in his human form. But what you find, is that familar voice from a German Shepherd coming out from the exam room. "Yeah, told you I was healthy! It's not like I'm out roaming the streets! Eating from trash cans and what not!" You are frozen in shock to find your friend in the same situation. He walks right passed you as he continues to gloat about his health. He sits down next to his older brother, who is at the counter making another appointment for shots next week.

"H-Harvy?" You finally manage to speak out. The shepherd looks around. "Who's calling me?" "Harvey! It's me! Tom!" The shepherd finally notices you. His tail begins to wag, and so does yours. You romp towards each other like two dogs at the park. "I can't believe it's you!" You exclaim. But finally, you two calm down, needing some answers. "I don't understand. Y-you're a dog too?" "Yeah, I just woke up this morning like this. My brother found me, eating out of the fridge. Thought I was a stray. Took me in. Your story?" You tilt your head. Amazed how close your stories are. "Mine's pretty much the same. Listen, we really need to dicuss why this is going on." Your friend nodds. Before he can say anything else, his brothers tugs at his leash calling him, "C'mon boy." Harvey walks alongside him. "I'll see you later Tommy!" He calls out. You whimper as he leaves, before you know it, you're called up next.

11121111111112.content:
"Didnt you learn already?! It doesn't matter how you behave, the fact that you're a wolf is reason enough to kill!". "Relax, I'm not going to live in the city, I simply wanted to bring a few things.", she repilied. You looked at her with a serious face, "Are you serious?". She just looks at you as if she had said something wrong, "Fine! Since apperantly you're the expert here, what are we going to do?". You pause for a moment, "Well, I was thinking we could go and live in the forest....unless you rather be in a zoo.", you snicker at that last comment. She simply called you an idiot and walked towards the forest. You weren't so sure if walking was the best thing but you joined her. You peeked a few times at her face. "So, uh....what's your name?", you asked. She looked sorta angry at you. "Well, you know, if we're going to be a team and all...", you muttered. "Kate.", she said quickly so you couldn't hear, but she wasn't fast enought for you. "Well my na-" "Don't care.", she interrupted. "Harsh." you murmurred, but this didn't go unheard. "It's you're fault I have to leave behind my life, my friends...and dad.", she tried holding back her tears. "If I had know that would happen I wouldn't hav-". "Who goes around biting people! You could have just gone aside!", you have to drop the subject soon or she'll probably end up trying to kill you, "You're right, I'm sorry. It's all my fault. But I have to leave my family and friends too.", you were unsure if that was a mistake. "We'll maybe you didn't love them as much!". There's too much drama and you decide to stay quiet for the rest of the trip.

After some time, you reach the forest, but it's behind an enourmous metal fence. Rather than asking a rhetorical question you started digging under the fence. As if understanding, Kate started helping you out and in no-time, you were both at the other side. You both look back at the city, "Sat good bye to our old lives.".
11121111111112.title: persuede her not to

111211111111122.content: That was the last you would see of the city life, as far as you knew. You kept quiet the entire time walking, feeling if you said anything to Kate she would blow up in your face. You finally reach a river and both of you start to drink feeling thirsty for the trip. You then see that it's getting dark and just say, "We best find a place to sleep." She agrees with a nod and doesn't look angry anymore. You didn't ask for forgiveness for the time being, for right now you didn't feel you deserve it. You soon find a small cave for the two of you. You offer her to go in first, trying to be a gentlemen. She then walks in and lays down, getting comfortable. You decide to stay outside to keep an eye on things making sure your former fellow humans haven't followed you and that makes think about never seeing your friends and family again. This then makes you cry silently. "Aren't you going to come in and sleep?" she asks. She then hears you crying, she realizes that she was a little harsh to you and comes up to you. "Hey, I'm sorry for the way a I acted towards you earlier. I know you must miss your folks just as much as I miss mine. But we'll have to put the past behind us. We're wolves now," she says trying to comfort you. "Thanks," You reply. "Hey, if the humans were after us they would have found us by now, so lets get some sleep. By the way what is your name?" she asks. "It's John." And with that the two of you go to fall asleep.
111211111111122.title: Continue...

1112111111111221.content: You are first to wake the next morning and stretch your legs out, and see Kate laying next to you. For some reason she looked like a cute wolf pup, and that's when you realized something. The cave looked a whole lot bigger then the night before. It dawned on you that you were both pups now. "Kate, Kate wake up," you say and she slowly gets up with a yawn. "Wow, who are you?" she asks, not realizing it's you. "Kate, it's me, John," you say. "What happened? You look so cute now," she says, blushing. "Well thank you, you do as well, but your guess is as good as mine. First we're human, then we turn wolf and now we're pups," you say, trying to figure out the whole situation. "Well, I actually know some stuff about wolves from science at school. And judging from our size, we are actually too young to be out on our own or eat meat," Kate says. "Wow, I didn't know we could tell how old a pup is based on their size. You know more then me," You reply. Just then you hear voices outside. "The scent is stronger now dear, we're getting close. They are definitely wolves," voice one (male) says. "Yes, but their scent seems to be that of a pups dear. I can't pick up an adult's scent though," voice two (female) says. The footsteps and sniffing get closer and then you see one of the wolves in the entrance. Kate hides behind you and you both start to back up in fear that they may hurt you. The female wolf says as her mate walks in, "I found them Blaze, don't be afraid little ones. We're hear to help you. You seem to have been through a lot, where are your parents?" You hung your heads knowing you can only tell them part of the truth and you say, "We don't have parents anymore. My name is John by the way, and this is Kate." "Ah, your another pair of those humans turned into wolves by the ancestors," Blaze says. "Wait, you mean you know about what happened?" you ask in shock. "And You say the ancestors did this to us and we would become wolves no matter what?" Kate adds. "Yes, so what ever happened between the two of you after you met was all coincidence," the female wolf says. "Sorry for snapping at you yesterday John," Kate says. "That's okay, I probably would have reacted the same way," You reply. "Well, we better get you two back to the safety of our pack. The forest can be quite dangerous for pups your age. Blaze if you could carry Kate back to our den," The female says as her mate walks towards Kate. "Of course Nyla," Blaze says and gently picks up Kate. Nyla does the same with you and you notice your body goes completely numb, making you assume this is a wolf pup's Achilles heal. They carry you back to their den and you soon see many of the pack members sitting around or playing with each other. They soon stop and pay their respects to the two wolves carrying you, leading you to assume that the wolves carrying you are the alpha pair. Soon you are in the den and the alpha's set you and Kate down. "I am going to talk with the pack about our new pups Nyla," Blaze says. Nyla nods and says as she lays down on her side, "Well, while he talks to the pack about us adopting you, come have some breakfast little ones. You've had a long journey, and you need nourishment." You soon see her nipples ready for you and Kate to nurse. "Well we aren't becoming human again. And we are too young to have meat. Looks like we're having milk sis," You say. Kate giggles and soon both of you latch on and begin to suckle, feeling warm nourishing milk flow down your throats. Nyla, your new mother, smiles and licks both of you, happy you have accepted her offer. She loves the feeling of being able to protect and provide for the two of you as you nurse.

1112111121.content:
You run for what seems like hours, but is really just a minute. Soon enough, you see a little hiding spot in some bushes near the park."(pant pant) Ok... I think we lost him" You start winding down and relax, all the while thinking of how your day's been so far.Then something catches your eye, so you gaze to your left.You notice the girl that you bit, now a wolf, looking a little shocked. Her limbs are shaking and her eyes are enlarged. You assume that it's probably because of the day she's had. Even though she's kind of big, almost like a full grown wolf, she's still a young girl... Then she starts panting hard, and occasionally looks at you, so you take the bait. "Ok, what's wrong? You look so worried..." "Well..." She starts, but pauses as though trying to find the words. "When we were escaping, at the part when I called to my daddy, he called me a wolf!... And at that moment, I was so shocked that it shut my human mind down a bit and I could see how my new mind took hold, how it saw the world. After my daddy called me wolf, I started thinking like one. I now didn't think of him as daddy... I thought of him as a threat and that all threats need to be taken care of, and I was ready to bite, even Kill! " You never really even thought of it that way and wondered if you thought of things like that when your mom was beating you with a broom. "And..." Oh, she wasn't done, you think to yourself. "I tried so desperately to get back my human thoughts, but I only just got it back! And while we were running over here, I looked at everybody and tried to think of them as people, but all I could think was 'meat' !!!... " You can see her going through the horror over again by just looking at her eyes... "Then I looked at you!" She then suddenly turns her head in your direction and stairs at you like you are the light in her tunnel. " And when I look at you, I feel, I feel as though you are my friend, family, and ... leader." She then looked away. It seemed as though she was embarrassed, but it was nothing to be embarrassed about, because it was a normal wolf thought.
The young girl (wolf) then drooped her head and started sobbing. You feel really bad for her and it was because of you this happened. You try to find a way to comfort her, but your wolf mind urges you to lick her (Please don't take it wrong). Then you get closer and wait till she looks at you, and then start licking her cheek. It feels good so she starts wagging her tail, and helping her become happy made you happy which made you wag your tail! Thinking of how happy you are making her happy made you lose track of how much you were licking her. After like a minute of licking her cheek, the young wolf realized how long you were 'comforting' her and snapped out of it. "Woah... you know I don't like you right, I mean you are the one that made me the way I am now!" Saying this killed your happiness and made you droop your head. "Hey, I'm sorry, but I'm just so upset that I can't have my old life back!" Then you feel something wet on your cheek, and you turn to find the young wolf trying to comfort you. You try to remember what she looked like before she became a wolf, but nothing came to mind. "Um, how old were you when I bit you?" "Well I was ...13, but I was always told I looked younger..." Hmmm, not much younger then you... " What was your name?" "My name was ..." Both of you just froze, you heard voices coming a little further away. "Let's talk about me later, we gotta get somewhere safely!
1112111121.title: You go to find a hiding place

11121111212.content:
"There they are! Get them!" The ASPCA were coming for the two of you. You had to get to safer territory fast!
"Quick! There's a forest not too far from here. We can hide there. If we make all the lights, we might be able to lose them," the young wolf said.
"Alright, let's move!" you say.
The two of you jump out your hiding spot and run as fast as you could. Unfortunately, the road is filled with cars and pedestrians. Charging through, careful not to get hit by any moving vehicles and resisting the urge to take a bite out of everyone you pass, you hear the ASPCA in hot pursuit on motorcycles. In the side-view mirrors of a passing car, you see they are armed with tranquillizer guns, and they are aimed right at you. You stop for a split second, and their momentum sends them sailing past you, crashing one of them into a telephone pole. The other man kicked it to full throttle and went after the other wolf. Not wasting time, you sprint off in their direction.
You run right past him and catch up with the young wolf, but sprinting causes you to tire and slow down. Your pursuer grabs a net and runs it just an inch or two off the ground. At this point, you are almost at the forest. He was just a few inches from scooping up the two of you. You dive for cover behind a tree, when...!

you bark and she gets on your back while pointing toward a street "Lookie! mommy¡s there!"

You quickly dart off down the path on your left happy to be free of the other wolf. Your heart is pounding in your furry chest and your shoulders are beginning to ache. As you make your way deeper into the woods you hear her call out, "You'll be sorry dearest! I can guarantee that!"

You get sick to your stomach when you hear that. Part of you feels like you should turn around and go back. Another part is telling you not to stop running deeper into the woods. Finally after what feels like forever you come to a crossroads. You're panting heavily and really need a drink. You can smell water off in the distance but you're unsure of which trail will take you there.


The narrow trail to your left looks as if it leads you into an opening. Tall trees surround a clearing and sunlight beats into the open circle. The one on the right is winding and seems to be much darker. It must take you deeper into the woods. You look back and forth between the two. You bet the other wolf/person would've known where water was. You look at the path from whence you just came. You could always go back, she wasn't sooo threatening and you really have no idea what to do now or where to go.

You pant some more, while you think, wondering what you should do.

you nudge your muzzle under her hand, and you let her stroke you for a while.
all of a sudden, she lashes out and wraps her arms around you. "Please! Don't leave! Help me!" she cries.

what should you do?

111211221111211.content:
"Well, were here" the girl says, "What are we gonna do now?"

You don't know quite well what will happen in the future, but you know that you wanna stay at her side. You look around inside the cave and notice some writings on the walls. It looks familiar, but you can't remember what they mean... Did that mean you were becoming illiterate?! You keep looking at the writing and with each line failing to make sense, you start whining. "What is it boy?" The girl says turning to face the wall. "Ooohhh! some crazy writing!" As she reads the words, you notice that there is something off of how she says the words.

"It's weird, I can tell what it means, but the words are misspelled badly!" Well, at least this didn't mean you weren't loosing your ability to read... "So here's what it says... Be warned that when two beings, whether animal or person, enter this cave, they will find that their destinies will be intertwined, in a magical way... Whatever that means..."

Both of you at the same time start to wonder what that possibly could mean when all of a sudden you both are interrupted by the gurgling of both of your stomachs. Both of you know what that means, it's been a long time since any of you ate. The girl packed some meat, and salad, and offers some meat to you. As you sniff you are surprised to find that that kind of cooked meat which you usually liked so much before, smelled unappealing to you now. You head to the opening of the cave, turn to look at her, and softly bark trying to tell her to wait for you. She nods as if she knew what you said, and with that, you leave trying to find yourself dinner.

While you hunt your dinner and find yourself enjoying this part of your new life, back at the cave, the girl decides to explore. After a minute or so, she stumbles upon a medium clear puddle. As she looks at the puddle she questions how the water looks so clear and if their might be something in there, but gets kind of thirsty anyway. Now she has a choice, to drink or to find a spring nearby. If she drinks, something could happen, but if she chooses a spring, she will have to wait for you, what will she do?
111211221111211.title: A story indeed...

1112112211112111.content:
Without much thought, she grabbed a cup from her purse and started drinking. After a while she drank close to a gallon of water. She felt refreshed, but a little uneasy. She thought she felt uneasy because she was guilty drinking foreign water, but what she didn't realize is that she was transforming from the inside. What she also didn't know was that the water she was drinking had magic properties. The other part of the secret in the cave was the water.

Before any of their town was built, it was a big forest and every month the cave was visited by many couples. One day there was a woman named Helen, who fell in love with a beast. He was a very kind beast, but no one was brave enough to get to know him. To them, he was a monster and people wanted him dead. Helen grew up hearing the story and thought of him as a prince of a fairy tale, but she knew not to tell a soul of her secret, because she knew that they would laugh and tease her throughout her life. When she was older, she ventured out into the forest and stumbled upon a cave (yes the very cave you and the girl you love are in now). What she didn't know was that this cave belonged to the beast and that this was his home. She stayed in the cave thinking it was really pretty and drew pictures of the beast to entertain herself before leaving the cave. What Helen didn't know was that while she was drawing, the beast came back from his hunt. He came real slow like and began watching her draw. When he noticed that she was drawing him, he became happy, and thought that this woman maybe would be kind enough to be his friend. After she was finished, she put a crown on the top of his head. When she turned around, she finally saw that she was not alone. The beast could tell she was very frightened, so he rolled where his stomach was facing up and made small whimpers to show he was friendly. As Helen looked more deep into his eyes, she knew that he was the beast, and she hugged him. Soon she visited the beast everyday and they would spend all day together. Eventually, Helen learned his language and they would tell each other everything. She finally made the choice to live with him and everything was perfect. While living with him, she found this wall near the front of the cave and thought of her beast. She decided to write what she believed, and because she heard of other couples becoming one when they entered this cave, she wrote her thoughts.
While exploring her and the beast's cave, she found a puddle (the same one your loved one found and drank the water from). She looked at how clear it was and decided to drink, but not before saying a little something as a toast. "Please," she started. "Please let me stay in the beast's life as long as I can!" As she drank, she felt uneasy. She thought she would die, so she said another little toast. "I love my beast, and for the future, help all lovers who drink this drink to be together and help them stay with each other forever..." and with that she fell asleep. When she woke up, she was shocked at two things. One, she was alive! And the other, she wasn't human! She looked just like the beast, but more feminine. Helen felt shocked and didn't know what to do, and if that wasn't enough, her beast had just came back from a successful hunt only to find another him (feminine of course). At first, he didn't know it was Helen, but after looking into her eyes like she did with him, he realized it was her. She is still in shock of what just happened, but was more relaxed now that her beast knew who she was. He licked her tear stained cheeks and they huddled together for the rest of the day. Years later they grew old and had altered pups. They ruled the forest for years and years to come and are known as wolves.

When you get back from your hunt, you notice that something is wrong with the girl you love and decide to investigate. You come to the conclusion that she needs some sleep. You clamp your muzzle on the neck of her shirt collar and drag her to a comfortable spot of the cave, since she said that she was too stiff to move. You lick her cheeks and forehead trying to do everything you can to comfort her and make her feel better, but to no avail. It seem like she's burning up, and you don't know what to do. All you can think to do is to howl

What's going on?!?!

"AAAAAAHHHHHHH!!!!!!" your girl screams as the pain gets more intense. You have no idea what to do and you stand there looking at her in pain... "What can I do?!” You bark. You get so upset that she can't understand you, but you look a little closer and notice that even though she's gripping with pain, she's asleep! It starts with her ears. When you noticed something was different, they were already fairly pointed and were very high on her head… “Wha-?” you say to yourself, and know that something was happening to her, so you look all over her body. You now notice some other changes in her body. Her now mutated hands and feet look more animal then human, and you see a tail? Yes, a real tail that seems to still be growing!! “H-Hey!!! W-Wake up!!! C’mon, wake up!” You bark. You keep barking and then stop to see fur growing, but not just any fur… White fur! Now you finally realize what’s going on and don’t know whether to make the changes stop or let them happen, even though it wasn’t your choice to make. At one point of view, you know that this will be horrible for her and she will fear this for her whole life. At your view on things, this would be the best, because now you could be with your girl forever!
The changes were almost done and her clothes were like big drapes now. She wasn’t moaning like a human, but whining and moaning like a dog! You try to wake her up,.. with licking her cheek. She starts to stir and looks up at you. “Hey wolf, what happened?” You don’t know whether to talk to her or to just bark, and all that wondering makes you tilt your head. The new wolf starts to get up, and then instinctively shakes her body. “Whoa, why did I just do that?!” That’s when she starts to look at her self. “… A-…U- WHAT HAPPENED!!!! NOOOOOOooooooooo!!!!!” Her howl made her blush, and now remembers that you’re in the cave still.”Did you do this to me?!” She growled, she was shocked at how much wolf she has become (though this is just the way they talk) already. You finally talk to try and set things straight. “No! I would never want to hurt you!” “Ahhh!!!” Hearing you talk and her understanding you for the first time made her even more shocked. “How come I can understand you!?” “ Well, you are a wolf now…” “What’s gonna happen now?” She asked with fear in her eyes. ”I don’t know, but at least we’re together and you kind of got what you wanted…” “What are you tal-“ and then she remembered what she told you at the park. “WELL THAT WA- ..uh, it was a figure of speech!” You knew that she was stressed and wanted to do something to help, but your animal instincts only provide you with the answer of licking her cheek again… And she responds with…

She starts to sing the lyrics as it dawns on her that your howling her favorite song. Tears form in her eyes and confusion is etched upon her face. She says your name and you nod, wagging your new tail. "Oh my... but how?" She places her hand over her mouth and stares at you.

She begins to cry and you hug her for comfort. She pats her head before saying, "You bit me! I should ground you!" Then she begins to laugh and sob at the same time. She turns and looks you in the eyes. "I'm sorry if I hurt you baby! You frightened me! Can you change back?"

You shrug your wolf shoulders and then squeeze your eyes shut tightly, trying to will yourself back to person form but its no use. You sit on the bed defeated and tilt your head to the side.

"I don't know what to do! Would any mother?!" Then a look of wonder comes across her face. She leaves the room without a word and returns with your dog's collar. "Let me put this on you! I think I have a friend that might be able to explain!"

You immediately know what friend your mother is talking about. The crazy witch lady, Priscella, that lives a few places over. She always creeped you out but you had tried to be nice to her except...

You suddenly remember that you and your friends played a trick on her the night before. Not you, really, but you hadn't stopped your friends. Had she done this!? She had run out of the house screaming all those weird words before your group fled. You don't want your mom to find out what happened but you don't want to stay this way forever either.

Your friends! What if they had all changed too! You see that your window is open. You could easily leap out and run to your friends houses. You also know that wolves are no longer endangered so going with your mom would be safest but you dread the thought of going to see Priscella.

1112122211.content:
Well, I thought, there could be a lot of things that go wrong if I jumped out that window... So in the end, I ended up going to Priscella's house. As soon as we were about to leave, I noticed my mom attaching a leash to me, to which I gave a little grunt to her. After all, it's not like I would try running anyways.
"So people don't look at us funny", she said.
To which I added a short, stubby whine. But I, quite literally, couldn't argue with her so I let her attach it to me. Even though I knew I wasn't really a pet, I could feel my heart sink when I heard the click of it, a final surrender to my loss of humanity.
We walked to her house quickly, partly because people glaring looks locked onto us. After all, nobody would walk a wolf, much less have it as a pet. As soon as I saw her house, I yelped with shock. I knew about the prank my friends have pulled, but I didn't get a good look at it. There was toilet paper draped all over her house, as if the toilet paper she had suddenly exploded and covered her house. I was especially surprised, because she was as clean as a surgeon, as odd as she may be, so I expected her to clean up the mess. After a few more seconds, before I could even believe it, I was upon her front door.
Three demanding knocks came from the door as my mother tapped the door.
A beat passes. I don't know what to expect if she happens to recognize me, and I hoped it wasn't negative either.
She comes to the door with wobbly steps,as if she was going to fall over any second. "Why hello there Ellen!" She says in a surprisingly sweet tone, considering what she probably did last night.
"Hello Priscella, I was wondering something." My mom says.
"Oh?" She says, as if she had no clue what was going on.
"You see, my son's transformed into this wolf! I..." She pauses for a second or two to find the words. "I don't know what to do!"
"Oh, that's si-" Suddenly Priscella stops, as she has her gaze upon me.
"Um... I don't have a clue how to reverse this actually!" She says quite suddenly. Shocks flows through me.
"Oh, that's to bad... Maybe I should look elsewhere... Come on, now." As she begins to walk away, leash in hand. I knew in seconds I would be pulled away from a big chance at turning back. I decide to...

11121222211.content:
You sit there as your heart begins to slow down.
After waking up covered with white fur and being hit with a broom seeing your Dad with a gun come at you and and being shot at, the relief floods you that you're finally getting somewhere.
With all this drama and almost dying, you hadn't the chance to look at your new form.
Being covered with white fur is quite different and you can see the large paws with large claws in front of you.
You raise your right paw and see the large pads. Perfect for covering any kind of ground.
You then think of yourself as a wolf in the wilderness, or in the snow.
A silent hunter barely visible in the frosty mountains, powerful, free and...

Your thoughts suddenly leave you as you realise that someone else had just entered the room.
You meet the eyes of a curious four year old, no doubt startled out of bed by the gunshot.
Rachel. Your little sister standing there with a little doll clutched in her hand.
You're unsure what to do. You can see the fear coming to her face. A great big wolf looking at her.
"Rachel..."
You turn to your mothers voice as she starts to pull herself off the floor.
"Mommy?" she whispers.
"It's alright Rachel." she points to you. "This is..."
She swallowed.
"He won't hurt you. He's friendly"
You can't take any more and try to move to Rachel.
"A lion?" She smiled.
You smile as well. Little Rachel was like that.
"A big friendly Lion?"
You sit down next to her and put your leg out as best you could to hug her.
She let out a squeal of excitement as she put her little arms around your belly and buried her face in your fur.
You inadvertently let out a gentle whine and nuzzle her head.
"I've just talked to Bradley and I...!"
Your Dad's voice coming up the stairs made you both look up and see your Dad looking at the sight you two sitting together.
He sighed and smiled.
"Mornin' Rachel."
He turned to you.
"Listen, Son. You turning into a Wolf reminded me of what your Uncle Bradley was sayin' something about people turnin' into animals."
He shrugged.
"I called him and he recommends..."

11122112.content:
Well... let's see. You've just been transformed into a red fox by unexplicable and oncethought impossible means. Hmm.... Any takers on HOW you can stay calm?

Your entire body jolts with panic. You flail around on the bed, too shocked to say anything. Too afraid that if you speak all you could do is yip.

Your foreright leg catches on your bedsheets (which you must have kicked off in your sleep) and you suddenly find yourself wrapped in a tight cuccoon of your bedsheets.

This doesn't help at all, you panic even more and you find yourself going over the side of your bed away from your door (it's closed, by the way).

You're finally too tired to move after another minute of flailing within the sheets, but your mind is racing:

'What happened to me??! HOW could this happen?!! Who did this?! I don't want to be a fox!'

A muffled voice reaches your ears, which instinctively perked up to listen for it. Your entire body was wrapped up too much to make any sense of it-- only your nose somehow found its way out through a hole you had discovered last night.

You freeze.

'I can't let my family see me like this!!' You think. 'Wait. What if they're foxes too?! No, they would have checked to see if I was a fox too. I might be the only one!'

Again the voice calls, much closer this time, something was wrong. You could not understand it. Everyone only speaks English in your family, but that wasn't English. The Accent WAS though.

'Whatever happened to me must have made Enlish sound like that!' You deduce as the voice draws closer.

Suddenly, a knock.
11122112.title: AAAWWW, FREAK OUT! (Le Freak, se Sheik!)

choices: Do the only rational thing: Freak out some more!
Try to make sense of it all.
111221121.content:
Your entire body goes cold as the doornob turns. Even though you were on the side of the bed away from the door, and the fact that under your bed on the door side there's enough stuff to prevent anyone from spotting you, it was most likely your mom and she would check the side of the bed you had fallen off.

You had to get under the bed in order to get to safty. But before you can do anything, and before the door opens, you get harshely get pushed under it and you tumble out of the sheets, softly hitting the row of heavy boxes.

You shook your head and were about to attempt to move to see what pushed you, when the door opened. You stopped as soon as you pushed yourself up by your forelegs.

Your mom's voice spoke in that wierd language for a second. Then... dear lord... you heard YOUR OWN voice answer.

The disbeilif of this ended your panic and you peered around the boxes and through a gap.

Sure enough, you saw your mom standing in the doorway, completely oblivious to what was going on, and there was yourself, walking towards the door in your usual sleepy manor.

If they could, the words "Failiure to Process" would have flashed above your furry little head. As your mom left the doorway to go back downstairs, your dopleganger stopped, turned around, and bent down.

You were looking at yourself... except the eyes... there was something different about them. Your body then spoke, and you understood it clearly.

"I'll be back to kill you later, thanks for the body."

And then it was gone, the door closed behind it.

11122112111.title: Faliure to Process

111221121111.content:
You hear a familiar snickering and your entire body goes cold as you realize its your own. You are picked up by the scruff of your neck and whoever's in your body turns you around.

You hopelessly tried to make your body move, but it wouldn't. You screamed commands at your paws to scratch, or to bite your dopleganger at least, but nothing would move. You only felt your heartbeats quicken to dangerous levels.

You saw your face scrunch up in an evil smile, eyes cold and.... unnerving. They were unhuman.

"Oh, you're such a good fox," It taunted in a mocking tone. It switch hands so it could hold you by the throat. "You want a treat? Have a taste of death. Unfortunately, a taste is the same thing!"

It squeezed.

You felt a spasm of pain as your neck snapped.

Then nothing more.
111221121111.title: It's you.

choices: Window's too risky. The Door's the only way.
Door will take too long. Go for the window.
1112211212.content:
As much as you wanted to, going nuts over this latest development was, you quckly decided, the worst thing you could do at the moment. If whatever's controlling your body is going to make true on its threat, then you have to get out of here. And getting out of here means first to make sense of it all.

In fact, this actually does make things make some sort of sense. The most logical thing is that whatever has your body has put your mind into a random red fox, which is the easy, yet cliched solution.

But also unlikely, there were no reports of foxes living in your neighboor hood and there were things more avaliable. ...like squirrels...

You sighed, which sounded oddly in your new fox body, and decided that you had to get moving.

Slowly, you tried to stand up on all fours, trying to keep the weight evenly distributed on them. After a minute, you finally prefected it.

It was an odd sensation. You new that you were standing like any fox would, but you couldn't help feeling that you had to get off your hands.

Movement #2: Walking.

Now you have a problem. Walking with two legs is rather straight foreward-- you put one foot in front of the other.

But with four, you weren't sure in what order to move them. You never really watched dogs walk, you just know how they run because we all can remember a dog racing to get a frisbee.

It was obvious that you needed to move one of your forelegs to start it off, so you took one step with your right, stopping mid stride to balance again. You moved the left forward, then carefully the back right, then left.

Yay! You moved foreward one step and it only took you a minute.

You sighed at yourself again. Then looked over your shoulder at the open side of the underbed. This was going to take awhile.

You then had an idea.

Movement #3: the roll.

Rolling would get you there much quicker than this pathetic little walk of yours. With two little hops, one for fore and one for back, you turned yourself so that you could roll out.

Which you did rather easily, besides hitting your tail on a leg, you were a natural.

Oooh... the tail...

You quickly got up-- teetered a bit too far, fell back down, then carefully got back up-- and looked back at it. You knew why you had it-- counterbalance. But this new feeling you had with it.... it was eerie.

It was easier than you thought to move it. Left, right, up, down, circle, up as far as you could, down on the floor. You wagged it, laughing softly at yourself.

Why a fox? Yeah, you thought the Fennics were cute, its hard not to say they are. But you were indifferent with foxes in general. A dog would be easier to find around here...

...Maybe some weirdo is commanding your life with a click of a mouse and the clack of a keyboard...

......that would be disturbing and just wrong.

You did your odd walk to the end of the bed and peered around it. There was the rest of your room, much, much larger than you know should know it. But its not much of a hiding place-- your red, the room is green. You stick out like a Captain Kirk in Star Wars.

Alright. Not so. Kirk in Star Wars would be cool.

You needed to get that door open.... maybe you could pounce the doornob or build some sort of ladder... but that might take too long. But if you do get out, you can always hide out amongst in your sister's corner o' giant stuffed animals. She was a big fan of foxes and most of the pile consist them. You'll never be found in there.

...this transformation can't be because of that, could it?

Your eyes looked towards your window-- your room was on the ground floor and it's never locked. With a little manuvering, you might be able to open it. But your neighbors might see you... but it might be the easist way.
1112211212.title: At least you have Pointy Ears to help

11122112122.content:
You decide to escape through the window. Somehow you manage to get the window open and just in time, as you start climbing out you hear your body come into the room to finish you off. "Of course!" you shout, "my uncle Joe was put in a low security mental hospital for claming to be able to talk to animals. It's a long shot, but it's the only one I have."

Just as you get ready to head to the next town over to see your uncle, you realize that your little rush through town got the attension of the animal control. "This day just keeps getting better," you thought to yourself as you try to make your way through the park undetected.

111221121221211.content:
Your optimism is non-existent as you see two twin girls, looking no older than 6... come clambering down the stairs, with an almost inhumanly gleeful look...

2 HOURS LATER

         You try to hide under the dresser for the fifth time now, as the twins pull on your tail. The unusual pain in your most recent bodily addition, shocks you allowing them to make you their plaything. You're expecting them putting another tu-tu on you, but before they can their dad calls them down, most likely for dinner... bringing you with them, and clutching you so hard you're surprised you can breath. Eventually you remember that you have claws. Not actually scratching her but enough of a swipe to amount to a nip. This scared her into dropping you, as was the desired affect. You run downstairs, past the other twin, and hide under the couch, out of their reach...


         SHEESH your Doppelganger hasn't got nothing on these two. They can't seem to get the idea that you're male no matter HOW much their dad told them (you couldn't understand him, but you got the basic idea,) and now they're treating you like a plush toy... hunkering down, under the couch, and getting that strange feeling of a keyboard clacking away again, you decide that you could get to a wildlife sanctuary of some kind, or stay here, hidden from your Doppelganger, until you devised a plan.

1112211212212112.content:
As unappealing as the fact is, if you ran for the wild, you'd be pretty much helpless. What did you know about surviving as a fox? Besides, you had bigger problems. Two of them as a matter of fact.

Those six-year-old twin girls, to be specific. They'd NEVER let you escape them! From where you were hunkered down, you could see their feet as they waited for you to come out so they could catch you and make you their plaything again as soon as you did. And you did NOT want to have them treating you like a plush toy!

While you no longer understood human speech since your transformation into a fox, the girls' actions had made it more that obvious that they both wanted to keep you as their pet forever, and ever, and ever, and ever, and ever, and ever, and ever...

The idea was honestly terrifying to you. But like you realized earlier, they'd never let you get away from them. You didn't like it, but you were trapped by your two young "owners".

What made it worse was you knew you'd eventually have to come out to get food or something, you could only hope you could outlast a pair of six-year-old twin girls when it came to knowing how to wait...otherwise, you'd be their property for a long time...

Discouraged, you sit on the corner of your porch and slowly groom yourself. You will have to sit there for a little bit until your cat loving sister arrives. She had left early this morning.

She gives you a quick glance, then smiles and begins to pet you. You love the gesture and begin to purr like a motor boat. Suddenly, your front door swings open and your mother walks out to see your sister petting you. She immediatly begins to scream and yell and throw things at her. You are frightened and hiss in distrese. Your sister picks you up and holds you tightly.

"MOM!" she yells. "What's the matter with you?!?"

"That mangy furball was sleeping in John's bed this morning and now I can't find him anywhere! That cat probably ate him!"

You think for a minute. It seems like it would be more fun to stay this way, but maybe it wouldn't hurt to find out why it happened. Your sister sets you down, and looks at you expectantly, as if waiting for you.

You immediately prance in the front door with your tail in the air, like you own the place. Treading on the soft carpet you turn and saunter down the hallway to your room and jump up on the bed. With your paws, you search and look for what you did last before you went to sleep.

Your mother and sister stare in disbelief. "It is John," your sister says.

You look on your dresser and a book is open to the last page you read. With a firm meow, you jump onto the floor. You look up at the book and then at your sister expectantly. After an agile leap into the air, you sit on the dresser next to the book.

112112.content:
She leaned in close to the cat's face and looked and long and hard at his bright yellow eyes. Only a mother would recognize her son in that sort of fashion, and John was becoming hopeful. "Nope, I don't see any similarities."
"WAHH!??"
"Take that fleabag out before it starts messing up the place." With that, she quickly turned and slammed the door with a loud bang. It was enough to send ear shattering sound waves through Johns ears, and he pulled them back in fright.
"Don't worry John, I'll figure something out." his sister said encouragingly. "We just need to find a way for our mom to recognize you."
"Meow?"

Later in the day, John found himself staring in disgust at his sister's messy closet. Was this where he was supposed to live for the rest of his miserable life? A worn out, cramped area of his sister's room? He gave a meow in protest.

"I'm cleaning it up so stop complaining. If you want somewhere else to sleep, go ask Mom."

<i>Mom?</i> He thought to himself. <i>Right....like I'm going to ask the biggest cat hater in all the world for a place to sleep.</i>

He looked back at his sister's bedroom door and figured he could make a run for it. Anywhere was better than this place. Outside there were trees, fences, bushes, warm buildings and other places to sleep. It was a dog eat dog world, and that he could live with. Still, he had some doubts. His mother had the eyes of a hawk and could spot trouble 100 miles away, even worse, she was allergic to cats. So climbing downstairs and walking out might not be the safest way. What then?

11211221.content:
John decides to sleep in the box his sister had so "kindly" laid out for him, and jumped in. It was warm and fluffy against his fur, and for a moment he nearly mistook it for his bed. He yawn's, realizing how tired he was.

"I'll decide what to do tomorrow," he decides, and falls fast asleep.

John dreamed of standing in an open field, full of flowers, and butterflies. He was still the same gray striped kitten he had turned into earlier, and in this dream; he was a cat all along. Like any old kitten, he ran around and chased the little insects, which struggled and bounced against his paws. In this world he truly felt free and blessed, happy to be an independent creature that needed no one. Or, maybe he did? He stopped in place and let the grasshopper go. There was one thing wrong in this dream. It wasn't that he was a human who had been turned into a cat through some stroke of luck. It wasn't because he was dreaming of another world. It was because he was alone. He was a house cat, not a stray. Cats were the most solitary yet human independent creatures on this Earth. He was yearning for a companion, someone to hold him and pet him and love him to all eternity. Isn't that what a cat always wanted? To re-witness the same feeling that was there when it was born? He turned around, as if to run back to his house, but it wasn't there. It was just another field that stretched on for miles. Maybe being a cat wasn’t so great after all?

John woke up with a jowl. He was locked within a dark, cramped closet, and for a moment he thought he was alone again until his sister appeared.

“What do you want?” she yelled to him. “Can’t you see that I’m asleep?”

“Meow!” he yelled back in protest. He remembered now. He wasn’t dreaming anymore, he was still a human and he had a sister. Who, so happens, turns out to be the most I-Hate-Being-Woken-Up person ever. “Meow!” he yelled again.

“Are you hungry or something?”

“Meow!” he said, John meant to say, I’m lonely can I please get out of this closet? But instead his stomach rumbled.

“Hang on, I’ll get you something.” She walked out, still mumbling. “Stupid cat.”


A moment later John sat staring wide eyed at a huge sugar glazed doughnut.

“This is all I can find since I already drank all the milk.”

John was delighted. If everyday promises a huge doughnut, then maybe being a cat wasn’t so bad after all! He took a bite, and immediately became sad. The doughnut was dry and tasteless against his mouth. Now he understood what the dream was about. His mind was becoming that of a cat! This was enough! He had to find a way to tell his sister to find a way to turn him back. Before he was a feline forever!

112112211112211211.content:
Directing her attention back to the laptop, Kathryn started clicking away as she dove into her writing. She had apparently neglected dinner or even taking a moment to remove her gloss black heels as she lay on the bed. Her work attire consisted of her usual black stockings, pristine white blouse, and charcoal pencil skirt fixated high around her waist which created the illusion of her fit physique appearing all the more curvaceous.

"Hm, a cat kiss, haven't written a story around that before. And then I could... ooh, little toasty in here." Kathryn muttered to herself, unbuttoning her blouse to reveal her generous curves before returning to the task at hand. "At some point, I suppose I should find a new hobby."

Pursing her full red lips, she focused intently on the task of writing her tale on the bed beside you. You couldn't help but gaze longingly at Ms. Truax. Only in your wildest dreams would you have been able to be this close with her. And yet, in that moment you wished that you could be with a woman that was as kind, intelligent, elegant, and beautiful as she was.

Suddenly, a gasp left her lips, snapping you from your trance. As she shuddered, Kathryn took a few deep breaths. "Oh my, what was that. It felt like.. well, I don't know...." An audible, low grumbling began to emanate from her stomach as a look of discomfort crossed her face. The statuesque woman brought one hand across her waist, her blouse and jewelry looking slightly off. Raising a hand to her face, you watch as her wrist and lower palm begin to sink slowly under the cuff of the blouse. Her mouth agape, Kathryn's eyes widen. Looking her over, you could see her once skin tight skirt now seemed to be somewhat looser.

"No, this can't be real. I can't be..."

What had once been simply a fantasy for Kathryn was now becoming a full-fledged reality unfolding before your very eyes! Trembling, Kathryn inhaled sharply as she sat herself up. Casting the laptop aside and pushing herself to the edge of the bed, Kathryn lifted one leg and simply stared as her glossy high heel dangled from her rapidly shrinking toes. As she watched, more and more of her foot slowly vanished within the heel. Her stockings beginning to lose their once firm hold along her toned legs.

Looking down to her hands pressed firmly into the comforter, you both see the cuffs of her blouse slowly overtake her fingertips. As for the rest of her blouse, what had once been a form fit earlier was now growing more uneven and bulky with each passing second. Kathryn gasped softly as her chest began to pull away from the black bra that she had filled moment earlier, slowly revealing her still generous and perky breasts. Kathryn's ears, which had largely been hidden by her long raven hair, were slowly creeping through her locks to reveal their growth while simultaneously becoming more pointed.

"Oh hell, she's not just shrinking. She's turning into a cat too!" You think to yourself, elated with the possibilities that are sure to come.

"T-his is... I h-have to..." Kathryn yelped in surprise as the sound of something heavy hit the floor, followed by a distinctively similar one. Creeping to the edge of the bed, you could see the culprits, her heels resting on the floor before you.

Her feet dangling off the edge of the bed, you watch Kathryn wiggle her toes with rapt fascination. "O-oh, this all feels... so weird... but I need..." Her gaze quickly shifts from her feet to her phone which sits in the brieface across the room. Kathryn had already lost a considerable amount of size by now, perhaps an entire foot by your estimation. As she attempted to slide off the bed to reach the phone, the shrinking woman found herself off balance and tripping to the floor. Nimbly landing on her hands and knees, she instantly froze at the sight that greeted her. Peaking out of the sleeves of her blouse where her slender fingers had once been, were now a pair of what resembled stubby, feline paws. Her perfect fingernails seemingly becoming absorbed through her skin as they turned dark and claw like. Around her sat the rings and bracelets which had adorned her moments earlier, having slipped off her body effortlessly during the fall.

"Oh no... paws. I have real paws!" As she lay mesmerized on all fours, you are completely engrossed in her changes from your perch on the bed. Her gaze was quickly broken by the movement of her pencil skirt slipping down her still generous hips to pool around her thighs and knees. Looking back at the offending garment, Kathryn's eyes locked with yours as you both stood mere inches apart your position on the bed and her's on the floor.

Lost in her deep hazel eyes, Kathryn can't help but smile warmly at you. "Unh...I suppose you're awfully happy about this." Kathryn laughs softly as she begins the task of picking herself up and walking to her phone. As she slowly pushes herself to an uneasy standing position, her skirt pools around her feet in the process. Noticing that her feet now resemble paws as well through the stockings, you hear an audible pop originate from her hips as she is thrust forward to the floor again into a position that is more quadrupedal than anything. Yelping with a mixture of surprise and pain, Kathryn fails to catch herself this time as her hands reach far in front of her and her breasts are pressed hard against the soft rug that graces her room.

With her hips driven high into the air, you see a small nub working its way from the small of her back. With each pulse Kathryn whimpers, the nub growing inch by inch as it covers itself in a dark fur that matches her hair. It wasn't until the last nub of tail pushed free from her spine that her oversized black thong slipped down her hips to rest around her knees which were rearranging themselves as they came under her body. Beads of sweat building on her brow, Kathryn looked back to her hips to see a tail connected at the small of her back covered in a fur that matched her hair, gently waving in the open air.

“Oh no, I have a tail! I need to hurry.” Shaking, Kathryn pushed herself up to her forepaws to quickly discover that she could no longer stand. Determined not to be confined to a life on all fours, she willed herself forward. Her trailing clothes had other plans as the undergarments bunched around her feet and pantyhose. As she kicked her legs in frustration, you hop down from your perch to assist Ms. Truax by holding the end of the pantyhose one after the other with your claws. Kicking herself free of her once skin tight leggings she turns around, meeting you with a puzzled expression. “Oh no, you’re looking… really big… which means I...” Breaking her gaze from you, she looks to her shrinking legs which themelves sport paws now. Making matters worse, her once athletic and toned legs have migrated almost entirely under her hips with the heels of her feet having long pushed themselves free of the floor.

Now completely exposed from the waist down, your view from square behind Ms. Truax leaves you ecstatic. It won’t be much longer! In fact, she’s only around three, perhaps four times your size now. At most four feet tall you estimate, although it’s hard to guess when you’re only 9 inches yourself.

Kathryn set herself to the task of using her new paws and legs as she clumsily traveled the few feet to the black leather briefcase. Pawing at the bag with some difficulty, she managed to free the phone the bag as it fell to the floor. “Wow, my phone is a total brick now…” Pawing at the home button of her phone, frustration turns to resignation as it's clear it's impossible to unlock the device with the tiny palms of her paws.

"Well I guess that's that, but maybe I..." Before she could finish the sentence, Kathryn shuddered once more. Lowering her head and groaning in defeat as the final changes overtook her body, her raven hair parted to reveal two furry, pointed cat ears dominating the corners of her head. Cringing, a visible twitch could be seen in her face and jaw as both slowly pushed outward forming her feline muzzle. In the process, her once petite and slightly upturned nose took on a rough, pink appearance as her top lip split itself as well.

"Oh no... my... it's..." Kathryn's words were becoming increasingly labored, coming out almost as a purr. The blouse now hung loosely, dominating her shrinking frame as fur slowly began to spread from her groin and chest. Her breasts were now slowly retreating into her chest as a row of small teats emerged through the spreading fur along her stomach. Her spine arched almost instinctively as Kathryn's sex migrated and her hair shrunk into her feline scalp, now little more residual fluff atop her head.

Breathing hard, the transforming mother resigned herself to her fate as her body began to regress into the folds of her blouse with alarming speed. "Oh no-no-no! Nicrole hwelp mreow. . . " Her voice being reduced to nothing more than growls and meows. Slowly her body pulled itself into the blouse completely, hiding what had become of Kathryn from your view. All that was left now of Ms.Truax and the transformation that had taken place were scattered work clothes about the bedroom.

After a few moments, through the collar of the crumpled blouse emerged a dark brown house cat. The fur matching Ms. Truax's hair color, along with her soft hazel eyes. Sitting in her bedroom among her clothes, Kathryn was no longer recognizable from the six foot mother she had been moments ago. Amusingly, her pearl earrings were still fixated within her feline ears, the only vestige of her previous life to suggest that she had once been human.

11222211121.content:
Beep! Beep! Beep!

I groggily woke up and turned to face my alarm clock. It was 6:30. This was normally the time I woke up on school days, but today we were out on break. A shut the alarm off and rolled back over. I was so tired. I covered my forehead with my arm as a I remembered the weird dream from last night.

It started out like normal. I was walking home with my two best friends: Devin and Lauren. We had been best friends for as long as I can remember. We all live on the same block, go to the same school, and church. This particular night we had spent too much time at the local arcade GAME ON. We had a strict curfew and we were going to be late if we didn't hurry up.

"Felicia slow down." Lauren huffed out while bending over to rest her hands on her knees. "It is no use. We will never make it home even if you continue running."

I rolled my eyes. She was always the dramatic one. "I'm not running. I am just speed walking." She was right however. There was no way I would make it home. I did not want to be grounded this weekend. Josh, my crush, had mentioned that he was going to the bowling alley this weekend. I was going to go as well and may just happen to bump into. I had been psyching myself up for this opportunity. I could not miss it.

Devin nonchalantly stated, "Yep I guess we shouldn't have played that last round of Combat!" I glared at him. He was right of course, but he was the one who dared me to play. He egged me on so much, he knew I couldn't turn him down. If I didn't know any better I would think he did that on purpose.

"I know...I know but we can make it home on time if we take a shortcut."

Lauren stood straight up and stared at me. "You are not thinking about going through the forbidden forest.! No way absolutely not!"

"I have to agree with Lauren on this. We are not supposed to go into that forest.

Okay so we had been told all our lives to stay out of the "forbidden forest" no one would really tell us why, but our parents said if we ever went in they would scan our hide. There were horror stories of children going missing, or people going in and coming out different, but I'm sure it was all just a scare tactic. I mean what is the worst that could happen? Plus I was desperate.

"Yes I"m serious. I can not get grounded this weekend. Y'all know I have plans."

Lauren looked at me apologetically. "I know you think this weekend is your chance for Josh...but there will be other times I'm sure. I can't go into the forbidden forest." It did not surprise me that she didn't want to come in with me. But I was surprised by Devin's wordsl. "Whatever, I'm not going into the woods. That is madness."

I was shocked. Devin always had my back. Lauren was always dragging us from one adventure to another. I love the girl, but she could be a little flighty. I didn't surprise me when she agree that she wouldn't go. But my feeling were seriously hurt when Devin sided with her and not me. "Fine I'll go myself." I took off running despite them both calling out my name.

I slowed as reached the path to go into the wood. There was a sign warning the public to stay out. I'll admit. I was a little daunted, but I lifted my chin and marched. As soon as I had walked a few feet I begin to feel chills down my spine. The air seemed to grow thick and my pulse rocketed. I knew that I was just anxious, but I could swear I felt eyes on me. There seemed to be a fog so thick, I was sure I could taste it on my tongue. I was determined however, to make it through. Doubly so now. I couldn't wait to rub it in Devin's face that I had made it through. I didn't slow down even though my body started to feel a little weird. I was kind of tingly and weighted down. I pushed through until I could finally see the vegetation begin to thin.

I breathed a sigh of relief as I stepped outside of the dark cover. Automatically I felt as if I could take a deep breath and the sensations began to recede. Ok I thought to myself I as quickly put more distance between myself and the woods, I will have to admit that was kind of freaky. I don't want to do that again.

I ran all the way home and I made it a few minutes before my curfew. Only in my dream I felt a rumbling sensation in my chest.

I stretched and shook off the creepiness of the dream and the events of the previous day. I got out of bed to pick up my phone. I had several messages from Devin and Lauren. Both were worried. I felt a little bad because after my journey I immediately came home and crashed. I was exhaust. I still felt more tired than usual though. I part of me want to ignore my friends requests to check in. If they were really worried, they should have came with me. I decided to.....
11222211121.title: the next day.....

11222221.content:
Catalin woke up to the sound of an alarm ringing by his bed, its noise unbarebly high-pitched and loud... more so then usual. With an agravated growl, he blinked open his eyes, suprisingly alert and on nerve. His ears cocked towards the sound, and flatened in a sudden wave of fear and confusion. His ears can't move....?

He let out a yowl of terror as he lept out of bed, his fur on end. What was happening?!

He swung around the room on four legs, his eyes wide and alert. He almost backed up into the wall as new shock coursed through his trembling body, more terrible than ever. Across the room, Catalin could see a white spotted leapard staring at him through his mirror with yellow eyes glazed in fright.

Catalin screeched, and the strange sound echoed through the room and left an odd trembling feeling in the back of his throat. His tail fluffed up and lashed back and forth, and when Catalin spotted it in the corner of his now heightened sight, he jumped again, this time bumping into his guitar case and having it tumbled down and strike his back.

Instinct kicked in, and before he knew what was happening he had rounded on the thing and with powerful paws he batted it and dug his claws into its leather. He gripped it for a fleeting second, his frightened and aggressive cry ringing through his room, then pushed it away with a powerful kick of his hind legs, leaping through the air towards the opened bedroom door.

He was out of it in a quick second and running down the stairs at full speed, his tail straight and streaming behind him. Catalin was terrified -- terrified beyond belief. His entire world had changed, and he didn't understand a thing. Fear and confusion was all he felt, with only an animal instinct to guide him. He knew he still had his human intelligance, and knew that if he just stopped and tried to think maybe he would make better sense of what was happening, but he didn't. His instinct to survive wouldn't allow him.

He heard a loud scream as he shot through the kitchen. He didn't look to see who it was, but could tell it was his mother. No. He had no mother now. How could he? He was a leopard and she was a human, and there was no way at making her realize the animal was him.

Catalin ran to the front door but it was closed. He panicked, and bolted for the back. Closed too. His mother was shouting and now was calling for his father. The leopard still ran in vain, trying to find an escape. He needed to get away.

Catalin shot towards the front door again, but turned as he reached it, not loosing speed, and leapt up on the couch. Without a moment's thought he crashed through the window. It shattered around him and he landed in the garden below, the glass digging painfully into his pads and fur. He didn't stop though, and he bolted across the lawn and into the waiting forest.
