Your tail shows you are feeling somewhat nervous, and why not, the immodest manner you must live here being as, and everyday your body fur is the only clothing protecting you from the elements. Bovine fur is quite thick as is your black hide, the potion your drank grants you added comfort from dense fur and a sense of delight from that brute bullish desires... ha, that tickles your mind does it not, you need learn what to do and then just to enjoy being a bull!

Have a good first day here on the farm.
114122.title: A small meek man wearing a protective mask

1141222.content:
A wealth of new sensations from becoming as is this animal form, by being a bull the odd feelings of standing on all fours and/or having hooves too seems so different. The manner of stance, as on all fours and the neck holding up the more massive head, as how facing forward or lowering the head to effectively graze gives want to make for a smile.

The world to one knowingly becoming a bull became limited to a barn stall, several sandy corrals, and a number of green pastures to roam as graze, stand as do what is required for bodily needs, and wander, eying past those ever present fences. Fences were to a human as lines drawn to climb and cross, struggling ever to gain more and attain more things, but being a bull there is no such owning only the reality of being owned as hemmed in by sharp barbed wire fences.

Eating as do humans is experiencing the flavor and texture of different food, but grazing, as from that first mouthful of greenish mash, the flavor is dull, as is the endeavoring of a want to get more and more, and more, becomes a repetitive monotony. Not just green grasses, but the bovine mentality what prevails when grazing takes all comer's as anything and everything that grows from out the ground is a part of the daily meals. What this does inside that massive gut with four stomachs is a constant growling feeling. As is the worse and most difficult part of being a bovine is the ability and happening of regurgitating up swallowed graze and munch them like bubblegum to swallow and raise again more of the same and munch it into a pasty for of yuck!
1141222.title: Gaining a taste for being a bull

11412221.content:
As in any community there is a chain of command and an authority, as oddly enough with this herd of cattle they look up to the bull, and in this case the bull is too new at being a bovine to understand the pecking order. Thoughts as to "All a born equal," does not carry through to being animals, and this human ideal is wasted here where bulk and brutality rains supreme.

Looking around as see there a nervous herd of cow, heifers, and calves all watching, alert as to the movement of he the herd bull, they knowing better his scent than what he being new at the business of kingship, was looking for the hear-herd cow to do the leading of the herd.

Human ideas are lost within a herd, as being the bull comes with new virtual and virile dominating characteristics seeming granted since they did not come from an inbreeding. Names too are meaningless, as being an animal and so much a bull, the mentality imposes scents of other animals in place of names. Scents, smells, odors, and the general stench what follows along behind the herd as they graze of stand huddled in a snug group, nervous of all around their otherwise safe corral.

Ah then there is the corral, a place where is the herd and they being stone dull ignorant of anything a human knows, does anything and wherever they be standing, as soiling fellows, family, of even the kingly bull with a dousing of vile stink. All the taught reasons for personal hygiene are as a waste of thought here being one with the herd. Mature enough to remember what was proper and or expected hygienic practice, the loss of hands and their dexterity coupled with the lack of toilet paper, shows good reasons why from creation that animals, bovine especially are gifted their having a tail.

The tail serves the bovine form in varied ways, the more common idea what people think of it is to sway at flies. Be it then known that from becoming bovine and a bull, the tail might disturb the flies from landing, but to strike at and kill them is with a bony tail the wildest stroke of luck. Of it essence the tail works to offer a covering to otherwise tender portions and places of the body, what hot sunshine might toast, or winter chill might frost and freeze. The tail is as much a warning stick to the young and ignorant calves not realizing yet the difference between a cow and bull. As well the tail does something a real bull tends to ignore, as does a human born and transformed to being a bull of form finds as a nasty problem. Remembering the lack of hands, the dexterity, and no T.P. the tail swatting tends to smear what stayed stuck, wiping the remnants across the furred flanks and from this action causing the draw for more flies to come and find their delight of a good meal.
11412221.title: The bovine community

11412222.content:
Humanitarian teachings fail to follow when becoming an animal, and as is a bull. Slavery was abolished for human kind, but not so for they who are born to being animals, and worse for those transformed into becoming animals. Odd that with becoming an animal the passions and sensuality of it were the first to consider and delight of the concern. It is different the longer a span of time that one is as is an animal that the true status of self is realized.

Status not of being the bull to his herd, but governed quite by the plans and urging from he the farm owner, as is the owner of what is his property, of which the herds and the bull are as property, owned! The temporary retained still knowledge of what was and knowing of what is of the present tends to be a bother. Bothering most is the daily determining of where he the bull shall stay or go, as what is of an animal's wish is not the concern of the owner. In essence being an animal is a lot about acting as did a slave, even to when they as we the herd members are planned to breed as did the Bible say, "To multiply, replenish the earth!"

When human there is a meeting, communicating, as then choice to engage and marry, but not here upon the farm. As of us in the herd our wishes go ignored, if we as cattle had any such a civilized inkling. Instead, the Agriculture Agent decides from past experiences and testing as to who shall or shall not be allowed to mingle among the herd of cows. The reasoning for this new bull being here began to take shape after the previous, as elder bull died suddenly. His death left a space unaccounted for withing then herd rational, as the herd could not grow or replenish without a bull.

Strength and vitality are portions of what it is to be a bovine bull. These are requirements for living of a lifestyle mostly out in the open air, in any weather, without a roof overhead or the delight of remembered air conditioning. As by the heat of the day or the cool of the night, the natural instinctive urges and drives causes nature to continue a species. Bodily beauty has absolutely nothing to do with what nature intends. Instinct and what one might call as out-stink begins a relationship that culminates from a strong bull owing to healthy vitality.

Enough said on the previous subject, as the idea of what is or is not comes from the farm owner and in no way is the wishes of the cattle a consideration by us or of us, if we could or would?

"Sigh...moo," to want of something is indeed the most of the delight until one becomes what hey had so hoped. The being defiant to parental controls and social morays of someone still considered as being young, was the stimuli to birth a seed of discontent. It was from discontent that devils foster in the young being easier targets, that spells a drastic wish.

"Ha...moo," to be thinking as how and why someone such as I would from being human and having full human dexterity, would wish, ask, pray, plead of higher powers, for the becoming of a life form devoid of so much. The asking to be doomed as damned, by becoming for this one as is a bovine animal, as cattle, the male of the species, a Bull.

"Muroo...," ah yes, that is now the full extent of the new vocabulary, the single tone cry of a bovine!

The thought as wish to try and communicate with those of my species around me is nye to a waste of effort, as they are dumber than a box of rocks. My occasional wish to try and communicate with the owner of me or any of his people who care, or do not care but dislike cattle for many reasons, the least of these being the stench.

"Ha... huh, muroo," the mouth, tongue, and vocal cords, my larynx, either do not or cannot conform to do my want of forming words, words to convey my thoughts. "Ha," and what of my thoughts, except for rare times when via boredom I stand or lying try to think as would a human, all other times during either by day or night I stand, being one in a herd of cattle.

Bugs, insects, flies, pests, these bite, some lick, a few tickle where they walk. Flies are more as friendly friends to cattle, they my their need to find food work diligently keeping both the far rear made cleaner, as some wandering due south, do their best to tickle the long hairs.

Life since the transition-transformation sequence lost it glamour after the second day of being a Bull.

Let it be said to all who for whatever their reason be, that wanting, and/or the accepting your becoming as is an animal, culminates about the word drudgery. It is sheer harsh as menial a lifestyle, answering to instinctive drives-urges, and given from these to act or react, doing in public what to a human is an utter from of disgrace.

"Hello big boy, its OK you need not try to offer a response, its just that I know you were not born to being as bull. I would like to be as your one human friend during your stay here at our farm.

Who am I, I would expect you in your mind and from the menial state it is by being as cattle, a bovine, and a brute male bull, such should be your question you would like as answered.

My name is Shanna, I was born of my mother who seduced my father. I am all human but I am more in that my mother and now myself, we are witches. Yes witches, not so much like black nor fully white is our magic, more the gray type, common witches, doing what he can for our devil masters.

One night on a calm as dry and mild evening a wandering legion of devils roaming heard the woeful pleading prayers of a human, begging to be set free from humanity, and gifted the physical form of..., in your situation, you wanting to become as is a Black Angus herd-sire Bull.

You were the answer to find devilish fun on a calm night when the ravages of sin and hate were kept calm by the tepid weather.

The devils entered through your bedroom window being left open to let inside a warm house a cool as refreshing breeze. The Legion did encircle your room, each devil having his special ability, they waited until sleep took away your better senses, and allowed them to enter your mind though that personal devil, your "ID." The ID is in all people, its that dark to black hole of evil what try to defame a person though vial acts and disgraceful manners.

Imagine the uproarious laughter those devils fell over each the other when one of their Legion entered your ID and mind, causing a dream, your wild ambition to make the sheet and blanket covering you to gain a tented angle.

It was at that point, no pun intended, that the Legion knew they had a hot prospect. Their prayers went up or down to the dark region of Hell with a request they grant you your wild wish as to come true when you awoke the next morning.

You need not worry about what your parents feel or think, as the easiest way to make you a black bull was to do a mental transfer of your mind. They entered your head and literally copied what was the essence of your intelligence, your learned facts and figures, your history of family, everything that was you in your mental capacity.

So, everything that you learned or knew how to do was transferred, merged into the brain of Bart, my 4-H project pet Black Angus Bull. You were a gifting to Bart of some added and increased intelligence. You were gifted to me as a willing witch, wanting to accept people like you as friends in animal forms.

As I said, there is no worry about you needing to think about your parents, as come the morning after what was your human body had slipped into a comatose state. If I were you and wondering about if ever you could leave from being a bull and regain your human body, well forget it!

You are as you wished to become, you are a animal, a bovine, and the complete essence of a domineering, dominant herd bull. Your only reason for being alive is to work at keeping either milk flowing or calves coming to replace those who we sell and go the way that cows and cattle do that get sold. If you remain vigilant to your duties as a herd bull, then you might well live here at the farm for the next twenty years.

Think on that as your real worth, of what will keep you alive and not sent, sold, and need follow others in a line where only death and disfiguring is a sad future. I can understand you think my attitude is harsh, but try now to understand this, you are an animal, you are property, you have no constitutional rights under the laws, and you are a beast, a bull, with one main purpose for living a life." Shanna said, explaining much, calming some wonderments, and adding some horrors to an otherwise bland existence.

You halt in sudden surprise as your new vision makes out the appearance of a beautiful, young, white-tailed doe...she's exactly the same kind as you.

You climb into the bathtub with difficulty and turn on the shower attatchment. For some reason, it crossed your mind that it would wake you up if you put the water on the hottest setting. It did hurt you, but you didn't wake up, and though you didn't mean to you let out a cry of pain.

Unfortunately, your mum happened to hear this.

"Glen, are you ok?", she half asked, half shouted up the stairs. You are officially stuck. You knew she would come up if you didn't answer, but she would hear the new you if you did. You decided to keep quiet, as this would give you longer to think of something to do.

Your super sensitive ears pick up your mum coming upstairs, and your tail goes up as a warning. You turned off the shower when your mum asked you the question, and were now trying to dry yourself, when she opened the door.

114212.title: Psycho-Esque

Just as you run through the door, you realise the enourmity of your problem: Your in "The Meadows", a suburb of Nottingham, about a mile from the countryside and it's rush hour. To make matters worse, an RSPCA office is accross the road from your house, and they've spotted you.

As you run down the pavement away from the idiots in green overalls, everyone makes their effort to stop you. They probably just want a closer look at you, it's rare to see a deer in such a big city.

11421212.content:
You feel a sudden pain on your...er, backside. A sudden feeling of drowsiness envelops you, as you fall to the ground. The last thing you can remember is the sound of some people talking, and footsteps approaching you...

When you wake up, you find yourself in a cage inside some kind of room. You saw all sorts of machines and devices lining the walls, and your clothes are gone...Like you even needed them anyway. As you inspect your surroundings, you spot only a single door to your left, which opens as a man wearing a white gown enters the room. He must've been a scientist, as he brought a clipboard along with him.

"Well well well, it seems that you're awake now. I was wondering if the tranquilizer darts were too much and put you in a coma. You've been asleep for at least a day now, and you even made the papers this morning."

"W-wait...I've been asleep for that long!?"

"Gah! Y-you talk!? H-how very interesting!"

The scientist walks up to you and looks into your cage. You back away from him, touching the bars of the cage.

"Now now, no need to be so scared. I have no reason harming you, so you can just relax."

He walks away, writing something on the clipboard. Your stomach starts rumbling as you remember not eating anything yesterday, and today. You look around and find a pile of grass and hay to your side. You step closer to it and take a bite. It's actually not that bad! You continue eating as you watch the guy look at the monitor of some computer.

"Huh. Your DNA doesn't seem to match the DNA of the average white-tailed deer. I wonder if it's a bug in the system. I'll have to get someone to fix this darn thing."

Wait a minute! Maybe this could be your chance to return to your human body! You could try and get this guy to help you find out whatever it is that happened to you, and turn you back to normal! But you could always just keep your mouth shut. After all, you do want to find out more about being a deer. And what are the chances that a man of science would believe the tales of 'The child who magically transformed into a deer' ?

"Ugh, no corrupt files found. And the other systems are running fine. What could be wrong with this thing?"

Now's your chance!

1142211211112.content:
Decidedly, the lost of everyone who was around seemed to be as different as were the smells and scents they emitting, did strike at the big nose of your new self.

A shake of the head, the mane flicking, the feeling of it as much a thrill to part of your mind as it is a common thing not worth thinking much about.

Nervousness and a building sense of anxiety begins, it urges the flicking of your tail. Flicking turns to swatting of the tail as the anxious feelings tend to build, increasing to levels suggesting of drastic action, of running away, of flight from this troubled place.

Some mall part of what is you cries out, trying you to hear and make your choices from a rational advantage.

"Rational," it is a word but words, even those you learned and knew so well sometime and in a different reality, are becoming a vague as is your feeling wholly comfortable standing there and surrounded by all these other creatures.

Fear wins, and with a leaping jolt of the front legs and hoofs, the bulk of the body swings in a turn, and with hind legs springing into action, this that be then as a horse does charge off, running toward wherever there is not one of those foul smelling creatures.

Unrealized by the slow and meticulous degrading of the human mind, you still thing as though this were the rue you, while that of your body and mind relinquish any claim of ever being a part of the human race. Elated with your feeling of speed and running flat out, jumping of hedges, galloping, this you of being as a horse has you tied and bound happily in its grasp.
1142211211112.title: Somthing else

choices: Max out at your top speed.. and realize your horse-power
or.. lose yourself to wagging your tail up and down.. side to side..
114221122.content: Now that you're out in the open.. whats the first thing you wanna do..?!
114221122.title: Horsey thoughts. . .

choices: Go a different direction to avoid being captured.
1142211221.content:
You lift your head and snort, then take off with a burst of speed. Your muscles move powerfully as you race across the ground. Suddenly, you see a ditch up ahead. You check your speed, gather power, then leap over the ditch. The thrill of jumping over the ditch fills you, so you slow down to turn. You race back towards the ditch and leap over again.

This time, you continue on, getting used to the feel of the power in your hindquarters. Your mane blows in the wind as you gallop along. Your hooves make a rhythmic sound as they thump to the ground. Now you see a fence in your path. You check your speed again, then leap up at the perfect moment. You soar over the fence, seeming to hang in mid air as you cross the top. Coming back down, you land lightly and charge ahead.

Suddenly, you catch the scent of other horses nearby. Your equine instincts tell you to go join them. Your human mind, on the other had, knows that if you go that way, you may find people who will think that you are an ordinary horse and try to catch you. What do you do?
1142211221.title: Max out at your top speed.. and realize your ho...

choices: Barry takes the lead and you go looking for other horses
On the trot to become more like a horse
1142211222.content:
A host of differing sensations is stirring about in the mind. Your body being then equine of species and form it works differently than when you were human. How many times when playing had you not got down and walked on hands and knees mimicking how animals walk. The manner of movement for you has changed and you are walking on all fours, the rhythm to walking was the easiest difference to get to know well.

Everything seems so different, and not just the undeniable fact you are suddenly a horse, as an animal your form, but how people look at you, as what they think of you, showing less considerations or care about you!

Some of those who you knew when recognizable a human see you and become angry, throwing rocks and anything to chase you away from greeting them with your usual warm and friendly manner. Then there was Carry, who seeing you then wanted to ride you, she acted as her nice self toward a horse, something out of place in a rural housing plat near a big city. During your time of walking you felt your tail swinging, swishing, the coarse hairs making a rustling sound as they stroke across your then larger as hair-fur covered skin.

The senses are more alive, especially hearing and the ability to smell what when human you could not sense or just ignored. As the nose works to be a guide toward what then interests you mind, the ability to hear well, acts more as a warning system to alert you of sounds that might be a danger.

What or who passed through your housing plat during the night and caused this miraculous change to the real you, might well have done the same to others, as they and you might well become a herd. With that very thought in mind you hold your head pointed skyward and sniff the breeze hoping to capture the scent your mind would realize was that of another equine like you.

As with walking and going around to homes of those who were friends when human, most are still human, though to your delight friend Barry you discovered was grazing, eating in his back lawn, doing what that fat fellow did most, trying to get fatter. Upon first seeing Barry as he had changed, he looked sleek and well formed,. He was a red roan color of body hair and mane as well his tail. He looked very healthy then, his plump body fat the transforming had used to make his body work harder and he became a strong, hefty muscular horse, some sort of draft animal as you have seen in movies hauling heavy wagons.

You whinnied a greetings to Barry who quickly raised his head and stood munching did stare at you. As something of your mind and that of Barry each realized the other for being who they were before. He munching tried to whinny his friendly greeting ans prancing happily he comes to greet and want to sniff your new body scent.

As during the delightful minutes after first meeting Barry, the two of you snuffle, whinny, as make common horse greeting sounds. It is Barry who for some reason begins acting as if more than excited by the meeting a good friend changed into what he too became, and need then learn to change his plans for living his lifetime.

Together, the two of you leave where he had lived for many years, as you turn to give a worried concerned look back, wondering when his mother would get out of bed and discover her son as gone, as likely he would never return again home. As you wonder too about then your family. As of dad and mom, your brother too, you know that being what you became you have no place as part of your family and must find a herd to join, making them as if a family.
1142211222.title: or.. lose yourself to wagging your tail up and ...

11422121.content:
You wake up from a fantastic dream. Here was what you remember,

You are on a fantastic African Safari and you see so many diffrent animals that your head spins. Then you see a pack of Zebras that are grazing in an oasis just off the dirt road. You pull out your camera and snap a shot. Just before you woke up, the snapshot sort of developed itself in your brain. You can see the Zebra's magnificent stripes and black nose. You also see the rich hazel eyes that show an expression of self satisfaction.

You wake up, but, you don't feel like yourself

You pull your arm out from under the covers to try and catch your spinning head (your head isn't actually spinning, just a tag), thats when you notice a hoof instrad of your hand.

"What the?" you think suddenly. You try to speak, but all that comes out is a high pitched cry.

"I CAN'T TALK! OH, MY G.." Before you can finish your sentence, you see that your body is now covered in a white coat with black stripes. You feel the coat under your t-shirt.

"This can't be, this can't be!" you say to yourself.

You try to stand on two legs, its possible at first, you are given just enough time to notice a muzzle where your nose once was. You also feel a black tail swinging involuntarally back and forth. Thats when a sudden tingly sensation hits you in the center of your back. You teter for a minute then land on your fore arms.

"Ahh! I'm on all fours!" you think

"[Frightened whicker/cry]"


You decide to take off your clothes and head outside to clear your head, but do you stick with your plan?
11422121.title: Stripes

choices: The Thornberry family- Nickolodeon and Viacom's 'The Wild Thornberry'
114221211.content:
"Well, out the door." You say in Zebra speak

You gallop out the door, not even realizing it has become a portal...

To The African Savanna/b}

You don't even notice it at first, but you have walked through a portal from your home to the African Savanna.

"WOW!" You finally realize, "I'm, I'm, I'm in Africa! I'm as far away from home as humanly possible, and I got here in seconds flat!"

"You begin to run all over, taking in the sights, smells, and sounds of the vast Savanna region."

Thats when you see an R.V.

"No. No that can't be them?" you think as a cartoon you saw in your human pre-life comes back into your mind.

The R.V stops and you see people get out. You hide behind a tree and gaze with your head perked from behind the tree.

"Mom, I'm going to look around a while, come on Darwin,"

"No way! Impossible! I can't be in a cartoon! Or a cartoon can't come to life!"

A woman waring a bandana and a man in a safari uniform amerge from the R.V, followed by a Teen waring ripped jeans at the knee and a young boy that appeared to be suffering from ADHD.

"Wow, and I thought my sister was energetic," you say.

You begin to piece all the possibilites together, thank God Zebras are actually smart.

"No, it can't be. But it is...there's no other explanation," you say as you amerge from the tree.

The family is...
114221211.title: Not your average family

1142212112.content:
You finally relize it's the Thornberry family from a Nickolodeon cartoon you've seen before.

Your quite surprised, to see them in person

You back away from the tree, that's when you have a feeling someone's begind you.

You turn around and notice a young girl, maybe 12, 13 or so and has red hair done up in a interesting fashion.

Your amazed at what comes out of her mouth,

"Hi, my name's Eliza. What's yours,"

Your taken back that she spoke your language (new language that is)

"You...you can talk like I can?" you say

"Ya, its a long story" she smiles, she has braces.

"Oh, dental work eh? I know what your going through," you say sort of laughing (to a normal human, whickering would be all they'd hear).

She look's at you quizzically,

"How do you know about braces?" Eliza asks

"Better take a seat, and I'll explain" you take a sort of 'puppy' stance, with your hind legs in a sitting position with your fore legs still upright.

"You see, I wasn't always this way. Let alone, I just got here the same time you and your family did. Oh, how I remember my family, just with them yesterday, now I'm out in the middle of the Savanna and my family is over 1/2 a millon miles from here in the States."

"Did your parents get taken to some sort of zoo?" She asks as she strokes your neck

"No, you see. Oh how should I put this in a way that you won't make fun of me or think I'm crazy?

"Ah yes, now...before I tell you, Eliza. Do you promise not to make fun of me if I tell you?"

"Yes, I promise." She responds

"Ok. The truth is, I was once human. I woke up this morning to find myself a Zebra, just like in my dream I had the night before today. Now I know that this sounds so stupid, you probably want to send me to the animal preserve where you or your parents think I should be.

She continued to stroke your mane

"Wow, how interesting. Did it really happen like that?" She asks

"Yes, and if you don't believe me, I know somthing you probably think a Zebra wouldn't know."

"Ok, what?"

"Our current president of the United States is George W. Bush, and he is the succesor to President Bill Clinton. Bush is due to resign soon."

Eliza looks at you with wide eyes

"How did you..." she trails off

"And how about this, your last name is Thornberry. How I know? Because you where a cartoon character on a Nickolodeon show." You sort of smile

"You have to have been human with an intellect like that."

You and Eliza decide to go to a watering hole just beyond her camp.

You notice it's the lion from the watering hole, looking at you and licking its incisors.

"No, you know what? NO! You want to eat me? I'm going to go down fighting before you get one bite out of me!" You yell

"Ha! Rebellion! That isn't the key to survival, don't you know?" The lion says as it try's to take a bite out of your left hind leg. It misses.

"Ha! Is that the best you got? I've seen scarier cats at a petshop." You mimick as he tries to take another bite, this time for your neck, but you dip back and buck him right in the jaw.

"Oooh, so close, but no fresh tenderloin for you my friend." you say, as you luagh.

" Hold still! Your moving too fast" the lion says in short complain.

"Whats that? You complaining I'm faster than a lion? Well, I got the brains of a High School Sophomore and the bran of a (near adult) Zebra. I wouldn't be too surprised." You sort of snicker as the lion misses again

" oh I GIVE UP! YOU WIN!" the lion says and run's away.

"YOU DID IT! YOU PHYCED HIM OUT!" Eliza yells as you let out a happy whicker

She strokes your neck and holds your head close to hers, you continue to whicker with your eye's closed.

Now what do you do?

Do you...

You decide to aquant yourself with some of the more friendly animals.

You take a look around there are some zebras, antilobe and gazelle coming close seeing as a zebra has just defeated a lion.

The other herd animals come foreward asking you questions

they are
11422121121212.title: Meet the Herd

114221211212121.content:
Noticing that they are confused at what you and Eliza are talking about, (mostly astonished by the fact that Eliza is speaking all their languages and they understand a human.) you tell them your story, about you being human, then Zebra

"How amazing," the leader stallion says


"do you both care to join us?" the leader says

"Sure, do you Eliza?" you ask

"Sure, why not" she replies

The leader takes a palm leaf and grasps it with his teeth. He lightly brushes Eliza with the palm leaf and then you.

"May you be filled with the spirit and grace of our ancestors, god bless you two children." he says

Not too soon afterwards, you see Eliza looking a tad diffrent.

"Uh, Eliza? You look...diffrent." you say

"What do you mean?" She replies quizzically

You point out with your hove that her hands look a tad black and you see faded stripes on her arms and legs

"h,Hey. My eyes," she says as she notices her vison improving far better than her glasses can compel

"Oh, y...your becoming," you studder as she transforms

"I'm becoming a..." she smiles in excitement

" Your becoming a Zebra!" you say as you see her shed her clothing and backpack

"Yes, you are now one of us. You can chose to return to your human self, child, when you see fit."

"Thank you sir, Its an honor,"

"The plesure is all ours, come." The leder starts heading for the watering hole and the herd follows.

You and Eliza follow

114221211212121.title: Eliza's Transformation

114221212.content:
Yipe, the arm is black and white with stripes!

Worse was seeing you hand had become a black colored hoof!

When you tried sitting up in bed the body would not obey, you struggled to force it to move in a manner what became realized as something impossible. Instead, as improvising you rolled to one side with a plan to slip-slide out of the bed and did, landing upon all fours. That was when you heard your pajamas tear, the seams stretched to bursting, as then standing upon all fours a wiggle of the spine and torso tended to remove the useless clothing, it falling to the floor.

You stood then taking a mental inventory as to what was different and coming to the conclusion you were somehow changed, transformed, you were a Zebra!

A natural reaction to a zebra or any animal having a tail is the swinging swishing of it, this you feel in a strange way, something you care not to consider. The tail movement first thought to be involuntary is anything but, as it more than any part of your zebra self is able to twist, move, and contort to fight with bothersome pests.

Those first few steps and the manner of walking on all fours seems as comfortable as it did to walk upright like a human.

"Human," something as you think about what all of you seems as feels different says you are an animal, a Zebra, a member of the equine species, a herbivore.

Wishing to express your sense of horror and that growing sense too of contentment, a tried word or two comes out the mouth sounding more likened to a donkey braying than human language. The thought of lacking the ability to communicate with people tends to stifle you feeling of delight to some degree. Though the concern fades quickly and the wealth of new as different sensations, smells, and sounds you otherwise had ignored became a direct part of your new being.

The human knowledge that being inside a building, other than a barn or stables is not the proper place for a large body equine. Therefore it was proper to purpose you make you way outside, as where you live and being a zebra might pose new as greater problems.
114221212.title: Yipe - Stripes

choices: Bray a greeting to he or she is the owner...
Sudden fear of the future suggests its time to begin praying for heavenly aid
11422122.content:
It is a moment in life when what all is a memory or learned seems suddenly useless. Stunned, the urge is to struggle and learn to stand on all fours, knowing what you are means there is a need to walk, or run being a quadruped. What were hands are different joints, fingers merged to form a single toe, a hoof. As a look back and to that large furred behind swings a tail, stands tall on hind legs, having hocks and as well each a solid single toe hoof.

A shake of the head brings the sensation-realization that donkeys have long ears.

A tickle in the nose and without having hands to hold a handkerchief to blow, a harsh snort out the nostrils dislodges a goodly amount of greenish mucus. The yuck factor is born to the mentality of a man transformed into the bodily form of being a donkey. The donkey embodiment is not without its new as differences, offering physical sensations of sheer weight, bulk body, as well the lingering want to graze, foretells of wild days ahead.

Tossing all cautioning ideas to the winds, what is of donkey begins to make the mind follow after instincts. Life as known seems pitiful compared to the harsh reality of living donkey style. Thick lips, large teeth, a large tongue are but a few items about being a donkey what offer reasons for thought and consideration how best to use what is of being a donkey.

Happy thoughts come out the mouth as terse sounding brays, the sounds of which scare and remind one is not human, but became an animal.

Sensed is a wealth of otherwise ignored sounds, and equally unknown scents, some of what is there the donkey mind relates to of self and self stinks!
11422122.title: Donkey

1142221.content:
When you wake up, you noyice some thing different. Well, several things;
1)You aren't in your bed
2)You're surrounded by mud
3)You feel like you could litterally eat a horse.
4)you're a pink, fat pig, and you love it!
Yep. You're a pig. Turned up nose and all. You're extatic about this, you've always wanted to see life from this point of view and now you can! you first order of buisness is to...
1142221.title: Waking up in a whole new life.

11422212.content:
You decide to roll around in some mud!

You find a good puddle in the back of your sty then you go hog (pardon the pun) wild and belly flop in it!

The mud feels really good on your pink skin but it make's you wonder what are you going to do when your done?
11422212.title: Mud Treatment

114222122.content:
You look around to see some other pigs rolling around. You go up to one and say, "Hey where are we? Why am I suddenly a pig? I'm not complaining..."

The pig looks up and snorts, "We are home what ya talking about? Also most are born pigs duh." He walks away.
114222122.title: Meet some other pigs

choices: Try to talk to the feeding lady
1142221221.content:
You try to find out more of this farm. You try to question the others, but they think your crazy. Then you see a pig that looks melancholy. You go over to ask what's wrong.

He looks up. "You realize something is wrong here?" You nod. He is filled with excitement and squels. Embarrassed he says, "My name is Dante. That is all I can remember. I woke up a week ago like this. At first there were about two or three others that wondered how they got here and why they were pigs, but soon. They forgot and thougt thet'd always been pigs. I've notice that after two weeks and a half you start thinking like that. They'd been here longer than me. That is all I know sadly. "

He looked sad then his ears perked up at the sound of a bell. "Feeding time little ones." Female voice called. Dante said, "Madam Circe is feeding let's hurry."

You know you've heard that name before but can't remember much of anything since coming here. You only remember you used to be human and your name was Erick. No more details then that. You find a pig's life may have some up sides.
1142221221.title: Ask more questions

11422212211.content: You want know more but being a pig you do feel hungry. The slope does smell pretty good. You try some and go nuts. It taste so good you eat to your heart's content. You are pigging out (no pun intended). The lady looks at you and smiles. You want to say something, but your too preoccupied. This is the best food ever at least what you can remember. The lady walks away and you notice she has an assistance beside her. The slop is gone and you wonder what to do next.
11422212211.title: Time to eat

114222122111.content:
You find Dante who is in a better mood. "That was delicious. The best taste in the world."
"Yeah one of the better features of this place. Let me show you around. There is the play pens. We sleep over there in that area. Here, where we are is where we talk. Over there is the other slop. It's not as good as the other we just had. So what do you want to do?"
114222122111.title: Talk to Dante

1142221221112.content: There were various mud puddles and toys to chew on. The toy were covered in mud but you did't care. There is a small obstacle course. Dante and you play around on it. Soon the sun starts to go down and the stars shine nicely. Most of the pigs are going to sleep. You can hear ocean waves faintly. Dante says, "It's beautiful night. I'm tired." He yawns and continues, "Going to sleep see you later."
1142221221112.title: Play time

11422212211122.content:
You tell him you'll join him later. You creep to the fence where you hear Madam Circe and her assistance talk.

"Oh, Hellen aren't swine looking real healthy? They are soooo cute." Hellen says, "Yeah, that new one had the same reaction as most."

Madam Circe smiled, "Don't worry after about 17 or 18 days they are pigs through and through. I will care for them for the rest of their lives."

Hellen said, "Yeah, but the latest one was kinda cute. I could get used to his new curly-tailed form."

"Don't worry there will be more. I get people about twice a month. I'm sure you'll run into another guy. Want me to spare the next one?"

"No just turn him into a dog. Maybe a poodle or a lab or a yorkshire terrier or ..."

"We will think about that when we find a lovely man for you. You still need to study your animalism. You still have a hard time communicating with animals. Check on the precious swine."

She left the small house and approached the sty.
11422212211122.title: I hear something

114222122111221.content:
You dash over to the sleeping area with the other pigs. You're heart is pounding. Hellen walks over and stands for a minute. Then she leaves back into the house. You can't believe what you just heard. The lady can turn people into animals? You have to tell Dante this in the morning.
You wake up and Dante greets you. You tell him everything you overheard. He is shocked, "I can't believe she's the reason I'm like this. We have to find a way to change back. I'm becoming more used to my pig form everyday. Soon I'm be like the others!"

You both notice a youg couple a few yards away just past the fence of your sty. Dante and you rush over and try to talk to them and warn. The woman says, "What cute pigs They are squealing at us, Tom."
Tom looks at his girlfriend and says, "They look gross. Bet they'll make a good meal." She hits him softly and they walk to the house. They knock and Madam Circe welcomes them. They explain how they were going to Bermuda to wed but during the cruise they ended up in the forest. She welcomes them in.
114222122111221.title: New Arrivals

11422212212.content:
The slop smells really good, but there are more important things to do. You try to talk to her. "Lady help me out. Where am I and why am I a pig?"

She has a big smile, but her silent assistant said, "Why does this one squeal so much?" Madam Circe said, "He seems a bit confused. After about three weeks they settle in. They know I'll care for them forever. He does need to eat." She pushed you into the slop. At first your were going to jump back at her, but the slop was so good. You started to eat hastily. Madam Circe smiled as her assistance and her walked away.
11422212212.title: Try to talk to the feeding lady

1142221222.content: You don't care how you got here you just to have fun. You roll in more mud and eat slop. This care-free life is something you could get used to. You just don't remember your old life. You start to make pig friends. This place is paradise for you.
1142221222.title: Enjoy your stay

11422212221.content:
After a couple of weeks you start to forget you were ever human. You remember always being a pig. A pig approaches you and says, "Where in the world am I? Why am I a Pig?!"

You reply, "We are home. If you're a pig you were born a pig like turtles are born turtles, birds are born birds, etc, etc."

Confusingly she walks away. You can't believe there was a pig that thougt it use to be human. After a while she forgets the nonsense and acts like a pig. You spend the rest of you life as a piggy. A life you rather enjoy. In the process you forget you were ever human like all the ones before you. You are unknowingly trapped on Madam Circe's Island forever.

You're a gorilla. Awesome!!! You can walk with 4 hands, your not so different of a human, you like bananas.

115111.title: Gorilla

choices: How did you get to be like this?
1151112.content:
"Ugg, hoot, M...e s...til...l, Me, know who i was and am, the mind thinks slowly at first and the more I can think along one vane of conversation the easier it become to converse fluently. Really, I became a Gorilla, the offer to volunteer was my wish, but never expected this! Worse is the lifestyle requirements here, as people watch whatever i do, at time I get angered, roused with fury and throw at people whatever I find lying around.

Sad do i feel, memories, remembering my parents and wondering what they would say if they knew their son was now an animal, a gorilla in the zoo?

Fur, flies, itchiness, it is all part of being an animal imprisoned in a zoo.

What was promised, this is a far cry from those vain promises of fun and frolic with others like me, we being gorillas a family!

Ugg, hoot, woo, woo...ooo, owe got another insect bite!
1151112.title: A try to converse with you

11511221.content:
Some people say that having weird dreams is perfectly the norm. Is there anything odd about dreaming yourself as an orangutan? Or that you were trapped in the zoo? Or how about being a human mine trapped in a prison of unintelligence? All three of those dreams combined with surrealist reality can create one heck of a nightmare. That nightmare was what I was experiencing, big time. I was tossing, turning, as images of kids laughing at me and zoo keepers treating me like a Neanderthal tormented me. In the dream, I reached a hairy ape arm up to the sky in an attempt to grasp back a reality that was taken from me. All to soon, I wake up with a heavy breath. There was something about that dream that was... foreboding. I walked over to the bathroom, each barefoot step across the carpet feeling like a step toward oblivion.

         I reached the bathroom and looked in the mirror. What I saw instantly woke me up, it was very disturbing. My nose had melted into my face, only two nostrils now showing almost like a... Ape. I knew that wasn't a good thing, at all and what I saw next made it even worse. Looking down at my stomach, it appeared as though it was double it's own size. I was at least 50 pounds heavier than I was last night. If that wasn't bad enough my arms were nearly twice as long. I was becoming an ape, and it wasn't going to be a happy ending if I didn't figure out a way to turn back immediately. Before I figure it out I want to test some things. I open my mouth wide and clearly say "Testing." I was taken aback by how different my voice. Gruff, guttural, and not fitting a 16 year old boy at all. Suddenly, as if to complete that notion, my face began to tingle.

         Look in the mirror, my face became wrinkly and covered with a tad bit of mangy fur forming an ugly hair style. I could easily pass as a middle aged man rather than a teenaged boy. The transformation halted however, stopping after giving me ugly orange sideburns. I knew I had to figure this transformation out before the changes returned. I ran to a cabinet of old clothes my father used to wear, tossing on his old Dukes of Hazzard t-shirt, over my fat gut. I tossed on a ball cap that barely covered my ugly coif of red hair. I had to figure out to change back, and I had to do it now. Pulling on a pair of jeans that belonged to my dad, I quickly button it and prepare to make a mad dash. The pants fit scarily well, and at that point I looked more like a red-neck than a red-ape. Pulling a belt with a silver skull located at it's centre, I quickly toss on a pair of shoes that barely fit before running out the door. I had to figure out how to stop this transformation and reverse the changes. I decided to...
11511221.title: Going ape

choices: I begin to transform fully on the step of the building
I manage to get inside without shapeshifting
115112212.content:
I decided I was going to the hospital until... I looked inside my wallet. My picture ID didn't match my new persona at all and neither did my health card. No driving, no free health care and trapped in the body of a forty year old looking ape-man. I must've been the most sorry looking Canadian on the face of the planet. I decided I would have to take the bus. I decided to do a once-over of my form to make sure I didn't draw attention to myself. Luckily my arms weren't as long as I had thought moments ago. I guess the feeling of self threw me off, but there length seemed to reach slightly passed my knees. I had seen people with longer more freakish arms before, so it wasn't a big deal. However, the transformation seemed to know this and decided to make my life worse. Suddenly my back ached slightly and I found myself slouching. On top of that, my hands grew larger and thicker. "Stop! *Grunt* Stop!" I said to myself, my voice becoming more guttural and adding the animal noises of an orangutan to it's repertoire.

         The transformation ceased and I realized I was looking more like a forty year old man, and soon I would become devolve further. I ran out the front door, with a handful of change. I knew I had to return myself to normal, no matter the cost. The bus came in five minutes, which was surprising as the busses never arrived on time in the city. I hopped aboard the bus as soon as those door opened. My shoes clinked across the steel floor of the bus as people took no notice of the backwards evolution cycle crossing their path. I sat beside someone on the bus, who was some blonde woman. She looked to be about twenty-eight, and she was smiling at me. "Hey." She said proudly, "Are you new to taking the bus?" I looked at her trying my best not to give a suspicious answer, and say "Yeah, I guess you could say that." She continued to smile and eventually looked out the window. "What a ditz." I thought to myself. I didn't care about her though, I had bigger thoughts on mind.

         I decided that I needed to see the vet, someone who knew things about animals. Even if I couldn't halt the transformation, I could at least make it so I don't get tranquilized and dragged away in the middle of the street like a freak. I could have the vet transfer me to the zoo respectfully. I was surprised I was still thinking about dignity, considering I looked like half of the red-neck jamboree all mixed into one. I decided that there was only one vet in the entire city who help me. Gina Collins. She was the most kind and caring person I ever met, and both her and I respected each other deeply. Since I was ten I would bring my dog into that freckle-faced goddess of an intern and she would fix the problem right up. She was the last person I wanted to see me turn into an ape, but I had no other choice. I was approaching my destination and pulled the stop rope.

         I heaved my fat gut up, and hopped off my seat. Walking with my goofy slouch I quickly hopped off the bus and continued walking. If I didn't get to Gina right away, I would be eating bananas for life. I walked two whole blocks until finally getting there. I noticed I was out of breath, panting heavily. It was probably due to my new physique more then anything else. If I became a full ape, that wouldn't be much of a problem because it's their natural fat. However, if I became a full ape there would be a lot of new problems I stood outside the building looking at the place, hoping it wouldn't be the last time. I wouldn't want to be carted away to the zoo by animal control before I could spend my last moments of humanity with Gina. That is, however if I can't get a cure.

         What happens next?
115112212.title: Consult a doctor

1151122122.content:
I step inside nervously, I knew I had to convince Gina it was me. This would prove to be difficult, but I knew I had to tough it out if I didn't want to spend each day mating in the corner of a cage. I walked up to the front desk, and luckily Gina was on duty. "Hello, how may I help you, sir?" She asks, which makes me feel slightly embarrassed. I'm only sixteen, or at least I was, and now I'm really referred to as "Sir." I clear my throat and say "Yes *Grunt* I have a bit of a... problem." I say sheepishly, with ape like grunts inserted randomly into my speech. "What is it, sir? You don't seem to have an animal on you." She states directly at me, which makes me sweat a bit. Fortunately my transformation kicks in, and I feel it take route in my head. Quickly I threw off my hat, to show Gina the full extent of the transformation taking place on my head. The skeletal structure of my skull began to alter, as Gina stood awe-struck with her mouth open. My head shifted and change until it looked fully like an ape's head.

         "Oh my god!" Exclaimed Gina, "What happened to you!? Who are you?!" I decided to respond with the complete and honest truth. "Gina, it's me." I stated, "It's James." I explained the dream to her, and also provided evidence that it was really me under this loathsome looking form. "Come inside my clinic, I'll see if I can help you." She says, while holding back her fear for the moment. She leads me to the back room, and tells me to sit down in a chair as she checks her computer. "I'll see if this has happened to other people, maybe I can find a cure. She looks through her computer in the backroom for what feels like twenty minutes. Ironically, I read through a magazine on ape biology and numerous simian facts. I was also creeped out by the fact that I found a female Orangutan printed in the magazine somewhat attractive. Eventually Gina comes back in the room and states...
1151122122.title: An ape at the clinic

choices: "Transform immediately and get it over with."
"Wait for the transformation, so you can try to find a cure."
11511221222.content:
My mouth dropped as she said those words, now I was worried. "I'll see if there's anything I can do." She says as she pulls out a needle and plunges it into my arm. After getting a DNA sample she looks through it and doesn't like what she sees. "The problem is that it is attacking your immune system. Whatever is causing the transformation, is currently unable to be stopped. It's a virus with no known cure, and eventually you'll fully be an ape." She states, which makes me incredibly depressed. There was no known cure, was I destined to be trapped this way forever. "There must be something you can do!" I exclaim, fully losing control of my emotions. "Well, there is one thing. However, it won't cure you, it will do the opposite. I can give you a shot that will cause your immune system to temporarily let the alien virus in, causing the transformation to speed up. I think we should do this, because it'll be hard to explain an ape man wandering around the back of the clinic. It will also give me more time to try to find a cure."

         I became increasingly more panicked. "What do you mean by that?" I asked, "Why can't you find a cure right now while I'm still in this form? What if you can't find a cure at all?" She looks at me and flat-out yells "Look, there's no cure at this time! If I could cure you, I would! I would have to run various ape DNAs and human DNAs, plus I would be to get back into gene research which I haven't done in four years! Trying to treat you now, could radically alter your entire DNA structure to the point of being irreparable! You have two choices: You become an ape now, and I'll have someone take you to a zoo. Or, you could spend the next few days transforming while everybody wonders why a giant man-ape is wandering around the back of my store!"

         I try to calm myself down and breath in deeply, with garbled excited grunts in between each breath. "So, I have no other options then? I guess it would take a while to find the cure. I also don't feel well about just giving up, either." She looks at me with a rather serious looking expression, "Either option you can choose. Though, I would suggest letting me viral you out." She continues to stare me down, "However, whatever choice makes you feel more comfortable. Please believe when I say I'm on your side, I'm the only person that can help you right now." I look at her, and then down at my fat gut. I knew I had to make one choice or the other and I think about how painful it would be if I were just sitting around waiting for each change to happen. "Ok I made up my mind, I want to..."
11511221222.title: "Sorry, a cure hasn't been found..."

choices: I wake up, before Gina walks in.
I wake up on an examination table, with Gina preparing to give me a physical
115112212221.content:
"Are you sure about this?" She asked, "Once this happens, there is no turning back until I find a cure." I stared at her intently and said "Do it, if there's no other options." She nods her head in agreement and asks me and leads me to an empty room. She takes out a different needle, with a green liquid inside. "This will temporarily weaken your immune system. This room has been sterilized and thoroughly cleaned, so there should be no chance of catching a serious disease. On top of that, apes have different immune systems than humans. Even if you caught something, your new biology would negate it." I take a large gulp and say, "Is there anything I should do to ready myself?"

         "Yeah take off your clothes." She says bluntly, "I don't think it would be easy to explain shredded pieces of human clothing in my garbage can." I let out a half-hearted laugh, that was just short of breaking into tears. This was the last time I'd get to laugh, possibly the last moment of human happiness I would ever have. She knew this and made the process quick. As soon as I threw off my clothes she readied the needle. When she turned to me, she was crying. She was weeping for the sixteen year old boy. who was about to become a dumb ape. At first she was so saddened, that she kept pulling the needle away before injecting me. Eventually she worked up the nerve and plunged it into me.

         "The ape part of your DNA *Sob*, should take control very soon. I can't watch this, so I'll be back when your transformation is complete." She said, while turning away and walking out of the room. She closed the door quickly, as I sat there for the new few minutes waiting for it to kick in. Immediately, I feel a strange sensation of my body growing hairs out of every pore. Red strands of fur erupted from every part of my legs, as the strange, thick hair began to engulf me. More and more these hairs began to take route, blanketing my body. My arms and legs were now covered in the orange-reddish fur. The fur became shaggy, long and thick, hanging off my skin like hippy-hair. My skin began to alter as well, turning a strange shade of blue. Becoming rougher, and feeling much more different than I was used to. My skin changing felt like someone was rubbing sand-paper against my body' skeleton.

         Speaking of my skeleton, the next thing to change was my body structure. I could feel the bones in my arms, elongating even further. It felt as though someone had grabbed my palms and was pulling my arms off. My arms grew longer, until those bones stopped elongating. The transformation temporarily halted and looked at my shaggy, hairy and long arms. I flexed my new arms, they felt so very strange and alien to me. Before I could experiment further, my toes began to be pulled apart by the transformation. I flinched and cringed, as my toes were taken and reformed into strange finger like appendages. Like a foot massage from the underworld, my feet were being mangled into hands. My heel became a palm, as my toes shrunk along with the bones making it up. My spine made cracking sounds, and I found it forcing my posture into a four legged stature. I struggled to continue to stand, yet the hand of god kept pushing me down.

         I flexed the new muscles in my hands for a few moments, until the transformation continued in my head. Rough strange pad like formations began forming on my face. My face gained flat strange pads on it's cheeks, as the hair on my eyebrows faded away. My brows merged into a uni-brow, as my large fat cheeks finished forming. The next change occurred to my vocal cords. I felt like someone was jamming on them, like a guitar player rocking out during a solo. Strange sacks began to form inside my throat and I could feel them already taking over the way I speak. "Oh g--- *Grunt* Ple-please d-don't do *Screech* this!" I shouted as my speech was taken over by my new ape-like grunts and screeches. I continued to try to talk, but everything sounded garbled. Eventually, my voice got caught in my throat, only to be followed by bellowing grunts and screeches.

         Finally my body began to gain an insane amount of excess body wait, as my size increased somewhat. I became fatter and larger, gaining the size and stature of a true ape. I continued to grunt and screech as the transformation completed. The pains caused by my new change in form, was way too much for me, and I passed out. I belly flopped my fat gut onto the floor and twitched a little, before passing out with a large amount of spit falling from my new ape-like muzzle. I was now nothing but a Neanderthal ape, a zoo attraction. My life was over, and now a strange, new and more insulting life was about to begin.

         What happened next?
115112212221.title: "Transform immediately and get it over with...

I woke up on a plain white examination table, my hands and legs were fastened by harnesses. "Sorry James!" Said Gina, who had her back to me. "I had to strap you down. I wasn't sure if you retained your human mind, or not and I didn't want to run the risk of being murdered by a wild animal. However, I'll unfasten the straps if you can prove you still have your mind. Grunt three times, pause briefly and grunt again." She said, flat out in a serious tone. I could her the shakiness in her voice, she was nervous. I did as asked, grunting in the way she specified. "I guess that's *Sob* one good thing..." She said, as she turned around, I saw her fastening a white glove onto her hand. "However, I'm still going to have to keep the harnesses on you. This will make you flinch a lot, I have to make sure your unmentionables are in healthy condition. It's good thing I used to be a zoo vet." She did unspeakable things with that white rubber glove. After twenty minutes, the exam concluded and I was given a clean bill of health. Aside from, being a giant ugly ape, I was completely healthy.
What happened next?

choices: Get over to the nature preserve immediately
Wait at your house until sunrise
11522222211.content:
You are a boy around the age of 12. Your name is Mart, which is short for Marty. And you've always had an interest in kangaroos ever since you were old enough to know what they are. An old friend of your mother's owns a nature reserve which specializes in taking care of wild animals, including kangaroos themselves. Some of them tend to keep to themselves, whereas others are rather curious and often like to come up to people visiting, giving out cute looks in a hope for food. You love going to this nature reserve and spending time feeding the kangaroos by hand. You often bring a few nice treats for them to try out, so it's no wonder that these animals have taken a liking to you whenever you're around.

But then one day, while you were feeding one of the baby joeys, you suddenly noticed a big female kangaroo quite close to you, having hopped up so quietly that you didn't even hear her coming. But the moment you looked up, the roo bent its head down and pushed its muzzle against your lips. Like a kiss. You were so startled that you fell back in surprise and the kangaroos immediately hopped away. That was a strange thing for an animal like that to do. You couldn't get over why it would do that, but you just dismiss it and go on with the day like nothing has happened.

However, during the end of the day, when you prepare to leave the reserve, you notice the kangaroo that kissed you is at the fence and gazing at you like it wants to be with you so much. You begin to feel uneasy, as something about that roo is making you think something is wrong. Could there be a reason why it kissed you, or is it just a strange reaction to the way you've been treating these animals?

You can't figure out what it is...until later that night, it happens.

As you're lying in your bed you begin to feel very strange. Your knees are beginning to feel stiff. And your hips feel a bit rounder than usual. Then suddenly, you notice two lumps growing under your duvet on the bed. You try to reach to pull it off, but your arms feel strange too; it feels like they're shrinking! Looking down, you gasp as you realize they are shrinking! And your fingers are melding together to become a strange set of black, curved claws. Then you notice a layer of fur growing out of the base of your hands and spreading down the length of your shrinking arms. You finally manage to take hold of the duvet and yank it off the bed. You discover to your shock that the lumps growing in your bed are actually your feet, expanding in size! They are now growing to three times their original size, with another set of black claws where your toes used to be. Then you feel your ears moving and your nose and mouth stretching. You jump out of bed, and fall flat on your face as you suddenly lose balance with your big feet. As you struggle to pull yourself up, you feel something stretching out of your butt. Then there is a ripping sound, and your pajama pants are suddenly ripped off your legs. You manage to get up and stumble across to your bedside mirror. You look through it and gasp as you see that your ears are now looming over your head, and have become huge and floppy. Your mouth and nose have expanded about a few inches from your face and begin to look more like a muzzle. The layer of fur has now covered your entire body, and your knees have become stiff, forcing you to balance unnaturally on your strange, grown feet. You turn around slowly and see that a tail has grown out as well. What remains of your pajama pants are hanging from the end of it.

After a few more seconds, the strange feeling completely stops, and you are left there staring in instant shock at yourself in the mirror. You are completely speechless at first, then after a moment, you finally say silently to yourself...

"I'm......I'm......a kangaroo."

You try to bend your knees, and you find your body bouncing unsteadily on your feet. You almost fall back, but you feel your tail pressed against the floor, holding you up. You blink a couple of times, expecting this to be some sort of dream. But when your new body refuses to disappear, you become convinced that this has really happened to you! And the first thing that enters your mind is...

"!!!WOW!!!"

You have turned into a real, live, young kangaroo! You're not sure how it happened, but you begin to think that your change must be connected with the nature reserve somehow. Perhaps you should get over there and find out what happened. But you've never gone out during the night. Perhaps it might be better to stay at the house until sunrise, and try to find out what happened then. But what would your family think if they saw you like this? It's a tricky decision...
11522222211.title: A boy turns into a kangaroo

115222222111.content:
You've never been afraid of the dark, and you really want to know what made you transform. So, you move carefully through the house, which is not easy since your new legs are making it hard to walk. Then you reach the front door and carefully open it with your strange new hands. Then, after closing the door behind you, you practice bouncing on your legs to get used to your new form. When you get the hang of it, you start to hop in the direction of the nature preserve. You're surprised at how fast you can go by hopping. You feel like you're going faster than a bicycle. This is incredible; you're actually starting to enjoy yourself. Perhaps being a kangaroo isn't so bad after all, if only you knew what made you turn into one in the first place.

Within about 20 minutes of hopping, you make it to the nature preserve. You're overwhelmed by your speed as you realize this has taken about a third of the time it takes to ride your bike over here. You hop up to the fence surrounding the perimeter, and then by pumping your legs, you manage to spring even higher with each bounce you make. After a few bounces, you quickly move forward and bounce straight over the fence. You barely make it over the barbed wire with inches to spare!

Once inside, you feel the familiar feel of grass under your feet. You gently bend down and sniff at it. It smells even sweeter than you remember it when you were human. You open your mouth and take a bite. To your surprise, it tastes quite nice. It seems that your new form has given you proper instincts and tastebuds as well. You start to graze calmly at the grass, letting instinct take you over as you blend in with nature. You feel at peace here.

Suddenly, your big ears prick up at the sound of something nearby. You look up immediately. Something is coming towards you. You can't quite see what it is, as it's still quite dark to see, but you can make out...
115222222111.title: Return to the preserve

choices: There's only one coming towards you

1152222221111.title: Kangaroo paddock

choices: You new mother wakes you up to feed you
You wake up surrounded by kangaroos
11522222211111.content:
You turn back and look over at the kangaroo that is approaching you. It seems very happy to see you. You watch as it stops right in front of you, obviously being a full-grown kangaroo it's almost twice as big as you are. Then as you look at the roo through the darkness, you suddenly recognize her as the same kangaroo that "kissed" you when you were here last.

The kangaroo bends down and sniffs you tenderly. Then she cocks her head to one side, and suddenly...she says, "Hello, Mart."

You gasp as you realize that you just heard the kangaroo speak. "You - you can talk?"

"Of course I can," the kangaroo speaks again. "Since you're now a kangaroo yourself, you're now able to understand our kind. How are you coping with your new body? Isn't it incredible?"

"Well, yeah," you admit. "It is rather cool. But - but how did I get like this to begin with?"

The kangaroo chuckles kindly. "Because I chose you," she says. "I have always admired your kind, Mart. It's true they say some humans are cruel and unkind in this world, but then there are also some humans who want to make the world a better place. Like you, Mart."

You stare at her in a strange way. "You chose for me to become a kangaroo? But why - why did you do it?"

"Because we want for a better future," the kangaroo tells you. "We want to be able to understand humans better and make it easier for them to understand us better. We kangaroos want to make this world a better place as well, but to do that we need to understand their needs in life - " she pauses for a moment before finishing, " - and to make them understand our needs in life."

"Oh," you say as you see some sense in those words. "But...what does this have to do in making me into a kangaroo?"

The kangaroo gently strokes you on the head. "Because I want to help you to understand, Mart. You have always shown kindness to animals here in the preserve - even us kangaroos. We are your friends. That's why I chose you. I want to teach you about what it's like to be one of us - and at the same time, I can have a real joey to take care of - my own child - of course, if that's alright with you."

You think for a moment as you look at yourself. Since you have become a young kangaroo, and the animals here look up to you as a friend, it might be worth trying to learn what it's like to be one of them. Perhaps it will turn out to become another step closer into making the world a better place. Since you don't know how to turn back, you decide it might as well be worth a try.
"Okay," you agree. "I'll do it."

The kangaroo jumps up and down, clapping her hands in happiness, then she wraps you in a loving hug. Her embrace makes you feel attached to her; it seems to be a natural instinct for your new form. Then the kangaroo gently picks you up and places you gently in her warm pouch. Until now, you didn't realize that it's cold outside. You feel so warm and cosy in the pouch that you don't feel like getting out anytime soon.

"By the way," the kangaroo says. "My name is Cari. But you can call me Mommy if you want to. This is your home now. You are welcome here." She bends down and gently licks you on your cheek. You blush. "Okay, Mommy," you say, and snuggle deep within her pouch, closing your eyes to drift off to sleep.

But before you nod off, you bring it within yourself to ask, "How did I become a kangaroo anyway?" You hear Cari chuckle. "Well, let's just say I gave you a little kiss to make you change." Then you drift off to sleep.

The next morning...

Don't know what to do.

" Todd! Todd!, are you up??"
No reply. She starts up the stairs, yelling again. You realize you have no choice. You have to leave now, before your Mom finds you missing. You scamper through the kitchen to the back screen door. Standing on your hind legs, you manipulate the latch, and the door opens. Your'e free!

You cross several yards, wondering what to do now. What do badgers eat? Are they even around here? Where will I live?
I wish I'd paid more attention on that field trip to the zoo, you grumble.

Do you--
