"What the..." he looks up and sees nothing. He then hars a splash and sees you in the water. Does he............
12121121.title: Yes

12122.content: Are you a owl? are you a vulture?
12122.title: Owls

choices: Try to calm down and communicate with your family
1221.content:
You wake in an odd position with your head under the duvet and a numbness in your face. You manage to get out of the sheets to your now enormous room. You are about the height of your bed, a foot or so.

You try to groan but it comes out as a completely different sound:

"Quack"

You get up, flabberghasted at your image in the mirror, a mallard duck with its (your) green head and grey body, its (your) flat, orange, little feet used for swimming. Its (your) orange bill for eating water plants.

You panic almost instantly, flailing your wings about frantically, you do this until you actually start to leave the floor, which won't help with your situation at all.

What do you do?
1221.title: Duck

12221.content:
While walking across an Iowa parking lot Christmas Eve (and feeling a little homesick for the Canadian north) I heard them....that distinctive honking, high up in the cold gray sky. Rhythmic, excited...unmistakenly aching and haunting.
I stopped on the spot, turned, scanning the sky. Then I saw them - that unmistable flying "V" - coming in from the northeast.
I laughed, and suddenly my heart felt as light as air. The air beneath their wings.
"Look at you guys...you're beautiful..." I whispered, to myself.

Then I stood at attention, and saluted - as they sailed overhead.

I watched them disappear over the flat Iowa horizon, then went about my business with a glad heart.

The next morning, when I opened my eyes....

I was among them. I could hardly believe how effortless it was, to fly in formation. It took a little getting used to...the ground so far blow. Strangely, I felt no shock at the situation I found myself in. Somehow, it felt like a completely natural transformation - that somehow it just made sense. As I flew on with the flock, I wondered to myself for just a moment...had I died? And been reincarnated as a goose?

For some reason, I felt no remorse at that thought. It seemed to me I was supposed to feel that way...but I just didn't.
Nothing at all mattered, except keeping up with the flock, which was almost effortless.
I began to wonder where we were going. I was glad to be going there, wherever it happened to be.
I honked.
If a goose is capable of smiling - I smiled.
12221.title: Canada Goose

123.content:
You wake up as stiff as a board with a weird obstruction in your face; rather, coming out of it.
You try to get up out from under your sheets but can't seem to get a hold of them!
You opt instead to roll off the side of the bed landing you in a pile of feathers, and sheets. You free yourself and manage to get up. Staring down you remember something:

*Your pillows don't have feathers in them; they're modern memory foam ones*

Then you see your feet...

The horrified squawking sound you produce is so loud all birds (that can fly) in a ten-metre radius of your house flee desperately from their perches and a nearby cat stalking across a your garden fence leaps two feet into the air, lands on the wet morning grass and sprints to a nearby bush. Thank god you moved out of your parents' place last year.

You, who intended to have screamed a few seconds ago, stand looking down at your body. You had shrunk by about two feet and your feet and small and webbed. Moving up, your legs are practically invisable from where your side-facing eyes are and don't seem to be purticularly long anyway. Your body upwards from there is torpedo shaped. You hold what your arms and hands were last night up to the side of your head to see them.

They were flippers. No digits, no opposable thumbs, about half the length (relatively) than they were when you drifted off.

This is a purticular concern currently because your door is fully closed and the handle, circular, is up to your chest. Your heart starts beating faster (which it wad doing anyway because of the penguin problem).

What do you do?
123.title: Penguin

1231.content:
Ah! behind you, on the other side of the room, at your desk, is the chair you were using last night for paper work, one of the spinning ones.
You waddle over clumsily (it was going to take some getting used to) to the other side of the looming chair and begin wheeling it along like a shopping cart, noticing in your mirror the rather obvious emperor penguin waddling along with an office chair, not a common sight around the house.
After an excruciatingly long time you get back to the door. The chair is at the perfect hight and you heave your heavy body onto it. On your tummy you feel oddly comfortable due to the thick skin ('blubber?', you think to yourself) on your front side.

And... bingo!

You manage to turn the handle with your tiny, clawed left foot with your beak pressed up against the door and it cracks open. You fall clumsily onto the hallway carpet from leaning onto the door too hard and get up, wincing* The rooms in your tiny London apartment lay around you.

*I am aware penguins don't have very expressive faces nor mouths. Nonetheless, you try.
1231.title: Maybe with a chair...

12311.content:
You follow your (suddenly larger) stomach to the fridge, you repeat your chair trick to reach the handle and yank it open. Usually by this point you would take a piece of fruit or a beer out but no. You wanted something different and you had your new heart set on it.

Fish

At the back you see the long since abandoned smoked salmon that you tried once and found disgusting. It had long since expired but you don't care. You carefully removed the plastic with your long beak and deposited it next to the plate of salmon carelessly.
After about five seconds you have devoured the whole fish, eyes, tail, everything and you love it.
You lie down next to the plate and relax. If you had a mouth intead of a beak, you'd've smiled to yourself.
12311.title: Kitchen

12312.content:
You slowly waddle over to the door, about up the hight of the letter slit. You're able to use your long beak this time to push down on the handle and do so.
With some effort you manage to get the door open and when it begins to open you step back and open it with your flipper

"I'm getting the hang of this" you think.

You need to get some help on the street somehow. You'd rather be in a zoo than stay in your house and be discovered by someone after a month. You are also hungry.

In the coridoor you can use the elevator or the stairs to reach the ground floor.
12312.title: Front door

choices: Try to find some food (you crave fish, obviosly)
No! You need to get back to being human, on an empty, fishless stomach if needed
1232.content:
Of course, you left it open that night (before you turned into a penguin, obviously) to let the heat out. You can hear the sounds of the city outside, a bustling metropolis hugging the water of the icy Thames below.
If you jump, you might be able to reach the river, which will break your fall
If you jump, you might also not get far enough, hitting the street with an odd sound, suprising the pedestrians below on their way to work.

You have one chance

After a few attempts at jumping on your new legs off of your bed you go for it...

You jump. Flapping your flippers involuntarily as you pick up speed.
You, a nineteen-year-old british university student who also happens to be an emperor penguin, are flying.

After five tense seconds, you reach the cold river breaking its surface gracefully.

You have done it!

Even in July you expect the water's temperature to somewhat chill you at first but it just doesn't; it's rather like you haven't gone underwater at all. It feels about the same temperature as the air.

After a fraction of a second of confusion why, you remember:

'Oh yeah: *I'm a penguin*'

The bubbles clear and you look around.
You are about ten or so metres below the surface, holding your breath instinctively and easily, like you can do it for another twenty or so minutes. Other than that, you cab see little, even with your new eyes, only just making out the bed, another ten metres below you.
You'd've had breakfast by about now...
1232.title: The window!

12321.content:
You start swimming downstream elegantly. It's rather funny how clumsy you are on land and you feel much better now, like you have satisfied your instincts. Your feathers are perfectly streamlined in the water.
You then see a fish, a perch to be exact. You remember its name from when you used to go fishing. You've never eaten one before but you were able to catch it with relative ease and when you do, your instincts slacken even more!
After a while, you fill up and head for land, feeling bloated.

You arrive and -
12321.title: Try to find some food (you crave fish, obviosly)

choices: They take you to a zoo
123212.content:
You swim to the other bank and jump out of the water, satisfied with the meal, onto the dock. You shake the water off of your tail without even thinking about it. You would have gone red from embarassment if you weren't, you know, a penguin.
You reach the stairs and hop awkwardly up them until you reach street level.
People immediately stop and glare at you.

"Err hi!" you try to say

"SQUAWK" you say

You remembered you can't speak English the moment the sound left your beak.

The people continue staring and a few start recording video.

Then animal control arrive. You don't think the city has ever had any problems with emperor penguins before but they do reluctantly take you into their van to a temporary home.
123212.title: You are instantly caught

choices: They give you to the zoo
12322.content:
Swim to the other bank and jump out of the water, onto the dock. You shake the water off of your tail without even thinking about it. You would have gone red from embarassment if you weren't, you know, a penguin.
You reach the stairs and hop awkwardly up them until you reach street level.
People immediately stop and glare at you.

"Err hi!" you try to say

"SQUAWK" you say

You remembered you can't speak English the moment the sound left your beak.

The people continue staring and a few start recording video.

Then animal control arrive. You don't think the city has ever had any problems with emperor penguins before but they do reluctantly take you into their van to a temporary home.
12322.title: Finding Someone

123221.content:
You don't really think about becoming human again. It just seemed so unlikely, even more so than suddenly becoming a penguin in the first place.

On the boat ride due south you...
123221.title: Antartica

choices: It's dark outside. You've never been up this early in your life!
The sun is streaming through. Mum will be up to wake you soon!
1241.content:
The bedcovers felt heavy as you woke. You had the strangest dream... It was of strange shadows and felt as if your bones had been twisting and scrunching up. And everything was wrong but right at the same time. You opened your eyes, only to be greeted by a mass of material in front of you. You try to push it away with your hands but it't too heavy and your hands don't seem to be working properly. You groan but it comes out in a whistle. You smile at this but your lips don't seem to move so your eyes are doing the smiling for them, sparkling.
You're fed up of just lay in bed feeling strange. You have to do something about it, get up and get out! You crawl out of your covers, thinking how similar it would be to your every day morning, only you're not forced to do it like this morning. You get to the edge of your bed (it seems further away then normal) and jump back in surprise. Had there been some prank in the middle of the night?! You wouldn't put it past your two twin younger brothers. They were only a year younger, both sixteen, but they had the mischief of twelve year olds. The edge was miles from the floor. You look around. This is one extravagant prank, you think to yourself. Around you you can see you normal furniture: your dressing table, cluttered with odd moisturizers, scattered make-up you hardly ever wore, clips and hairbands littering across the top and hanging on the handles of the drawers, big wardrobe belittling the chest of drawers next to it, your posters of your favourite bands and desk with scattered papers on top (you weren't the neatest person in the household). The only difference to it all was that it was all enlarged. How the hell did Jake and Todd do this? It was imperssive, you must say. You were expecting them to crash through the door laughing and singing at the top of their lungs "We got you, Evie! You should see your face!" they never could stay away for long and let the prank get it's full impact. They had to show they'd done it and take the credit.
You waited. No one was bursting through the door. You couldn't hear any muffled giggling or anything. You frown. What was going on? You look down at the floor, it didn't look that far a distance... So you jump down. In the air, falling fast you panic. You flap your arms instinctively and shoot upwards. Your mind boggles. This isn't right! You should be going down, not up. That was the basic bloody law of gravity! And yet you were nearly to the ceiling now, flying. You can see everything from above. Maddly you are spurred at how much dust is on top of your wardrobe. What the hell was going on?! This was't right! Not right at all. Out of your mouth, involuntary, came chirps and whistles like a panicked bird. Wait a minute, you think, I'm a bird?!
You flutter down to your dressing table mirror, surprised at how naturally flying came to you. You look in the mirror. Brown feathers, all shades in a messy striped pattern like the bark on trees, your underbelly a light grey-beige and pink feet and beady black eyes. An in the middle of your face a yellow-brown beak. You looked at yourself, head moving side to side, skipping about the mirror. How did this happen? It explained a lot of things from when you woke up, but now their were floods more questions. You hear other birds outside and look to the window.
1241.title: Sparrow

choices: Squeeze through the window quick! You don't want to be caught like this!
You go and investigate, even though you're a sparrow. You can't just leave them.
12411.content: You go over to the window. It's open a little from you forgetting to close it last night. It's open just enough for you to squeeze through. But you hear a noise from your twin brothers bedroom. Your door is open a crack and you can see that your brothers' room is open too. You...
12411.title: It's dark outside. You've never been up...

choices: Two magpies hiding in the shadows.
124112.content:
You flutter through your bedroom door, determined. No matter how annoying and terrible Jake and Todd could be, they were still you brothers and your older sister protectiveness takes over. You were always like a second mother when they were little. You hear squawking from inside and shoot through their door to investigate, like a bullet you land smoothly on top of one of their two wardrobes and look over the edge to investigate. Their beds were empty. You look around the room. They're nowhere! Where could they be, you worry, what happened?
You feel something behind you and turn around to find...
124112.title: You go and investigate, even though you're ...

choices: They go past. They didn't check on you after all.
1241121.content:
You squeak in suprise. They were quivering, scared. You look at them closer, they were both black and white, their tails and wingtips with a blue-green sheen to them. You knew they were your brothers, even as birds they were identical. They put their heads down and look up at you. Evie?, you hear their voice in your mind. It was strange to hear them speak without moving their mouths. She could hear it was Jake. Even though their voices were the same, there was small differences that only someone who knew them could tell. He had a quieter and more watchful sound in his voice, unlike his brother, Todd, who had a louder more mischievious ring in his voice. One of them hops forward to you, studying you. Is that you, Evie? You roll your eyes. Yes, you two. you sigh in a whistle. Which one's which? They visibly cheer up, their heads go up and their chins out in their proud manner they do so often when human, looking strangely fitting in their magpie bodies. Todd the one who had studied her before said, nodding his head. Jacob said the one who had said behind and spoke first before. What's going on? He asked turing his head to the side a little behind his brother.
You rustle your feathers. I don't know! I just woke up like this! You hear footsteps. The noise must have woken up your parents! They come closer. And closer. And closer. What are you going to do?! You all screw up your eyes panic flaming through you. They're just out side the door!
1241121.title: Two magpies hiding in the shadows.

12411211.content:
You scrunch yourself up in a ball and wait. The door creaks open...
"What the Hell are you doing up there?" you hear your dads voice. Of all the things that he could have said, that was one of the lowest on the list. There was no screaming or shooing or even shouts. You open your eyes.
On top of the wardrobe you and your two brothers were much bigger and very human. Jake had been pushed off and was now hanging off the side by his fingers. You and Todd were curled up in balls on the top. You were grateful for the tall ceilings, so you wouln't be crushed.
"Really!" your mother said outraged "it's four in the morning, what were you thinking, climbing on top of the wardrobe, and at this time! Get to bed. NOW!"
You all scramble off the wardrobe and get into bed, head down and embarrassed. You rush into your bed, the covers now easy to lift, and wait for your parents to go to bed. When you were sure they were gone and settled, you crept silently to your door and opened it a crack to look into your brothers' room across from yours. You could see that they were there too.
"What do you think that was all about?" Jake whispered across to her. She frowned.
"I don't know..." You can see Todd thinking to himself, the same look he gave when he was figuring out a solution to a problem or planning a prank.
"Maybe we should talk in the morning." he said and they nodded in agreement and went off to bed.


The next morning...
12411211.title: They find you.

choices: You think this would be the perfect chance to runaway and start a new life,
But on the other hand, you're a bird!!! Find out how this happened
12412.content:
As you look to your left and look to your right watching yourself in the mirror you notice how smooth an faste your movents are. While you examine your new movements the cloud breaks and a ray of sunlght shines through the window and lights up the room in a golden glow and your feathers shine. You turn to look at you room and your jaw now beak drops open and you were to ecxlaime some profanity but all that comes out is a few small cirps.

         Quite quickly you some to realize how small you were, something that illuded you in thw early morning haeze and chirps outside start to become language you can understand. Slowly you hop your way to the edge of the desk a you peer over the edge and gulp, that drop would easily inure you if you jus fell, but you remembered how easy flying was, like you had been doing it your hole life. Looking around the room, everything seemed mazzive. The bed that had been 2 steps away is a full block away from you now. Suddnly you realize that your alarm is on and thats means your mom will be in here to wake you if you cant shut it off. You cant let yor mom see you like this, she'll jus think your anothe bird.

         You panic and jump off the desk into flight, as you think in the back of your head now natural that feels to be quite errie. Then as soon as your feel land on the alarm clcok is start balring. It scares you and sends you into a panic as it is much louder to you at this size. Your body reacts naturally, as you jump and peck at the off slider, flapping your wings as you do this. Within seconds your mom walks in mid room to wake you before she notices the bird on the alarm clock. She screams as you're sartled back in to flight and flee back your desk pass, your now giantess of a mother as she jumps back and runs to the bed to grab a pillow. You watch her as she turns back holding a massive pillow. You cry out "Mom no its me! Your Son!" as she starts to swing and you make a dodge and take flight out the window. Your mother leaps out and slams the window shut beside you and you watch, pertched on the outside sile as she turns off your alamr clock and leaves the room. Then it hits you, your trappped outside.... You look back at the BIG new world and ponder what todo.
12412.title: The sun is streaming through. Mum will be up to...

124122.content:
Oh Jessica, you really are in a pickle this time. Well, I am a bird now, maybe I should just run away and start a new life. No! Don’t even think of that! Your whole family will probably be worrying where you are. But, how am I going to show them I am Jessica and not a bird. Wait...that’s it. Ok, I need to get back in my room.

You stay perched where you are and look around where you just flew away from, trying to look for an opening. Then you remember. Duh, there’s a hole in the attic. I bet I could fit through that and sneak into my room.

By instinct at this point, you jump off of the perch and fly up to the top of the house, looking for the hole Sure enough, right above your room is a small hole created by a tree limb. You slowly fly towards it and push yourself through, a single feather being pulled off.

Ow! Ok, definitely got to watch the feathers. That was like a needle. Now, to get the the attic door in my room. I hope I can get it open.

You land on a board and jump along it until you reach the door. You look down at it and realize just how big it is compared to you now. There was no way you were going to lift that.

Well, there goes that plan. Damn, there has to be another way in. As your thoughts race, a gust of cold air shoots from a hole in nearby. Wait, cold air in the middle of summer? That means that that vent must be the air conditioning system. Maybe I can get to my room through that.

You jump towards the vent and look at it. Unlike older houses, your house had these plate vents that went right over the hole, which meant they could be removed. With the little bit of strength you had, you prayed the vent open. You could feel the air rushing toward you.

Well, time to take a leap of faith then. You jump into it and start decending down the small shaft. In the dim shaft, you see a glimmer of light shining through. That must be the vent you think to yourself. You spread your wings, which only just fit in the vent, allowing you to hover in front of the vent. You look through and sure enough it’s your room, completely untouched. Ok, guess I’ll have to ram it. 3, 2, 1... With all of your strength, you bang against the metal grate, but it did not pop out. Dust begins flying all around you, blinding you. Frantically, you flapped your wings and twirled through the air, hitting the vent again. This time, you break through into the room.

Coming out of your daze you stand back up and use your wings to push the dust from your eyes. Ugh, now I know why mom asked me to dust the vents in here. Too late now I guess. Now, I need to get my hair tie. If they see me with it around my neck maybe they will recognize me. You fly up to your dresser and find you red hair tie. When you were human, you always wore it no matter where you went. You push your head at it and get it around, almost like a necklace. You look at the mirror to inspect yourself again.

I still can’t believe I’m a bird. How is this going to work though? The second mom sees me she’s going to freak out. Maybe dad might be my only option. He does like birds, do maybe he might recognize me. Your thoughts go on for a minute or so, and then, reluctantly, you hop off the dresser and start to fly to your door. Luckily, your mom had left it open. Downstairs, you could hear everyone eating breakfast, completely unaware you were missing. That was about to change, however, as you flew downstairs and towards the table.

Swooping down from the ceiling, you landed right in front of your dad. You begin calling up to him, chirps and cheeps coming from your beak. Everyone looks at you, your mother horrified.

“Aw, the birds back! Charlie, get it! Get it!” Your mother almost fell out of her chair out of complete shock. Your brothers looked at you intriguingly. You just stood there, looking at your father.

“Calm down honey, it’s only a bird. It is chirping weirdly though.”

You called out to your dad “Dad, it’s me, Jessica. Please, recognize me,” but only chirps came from your beak. He cupped his hands around you and examined you curiously.

“Hmm, never seen a bird act like this before.”

“I don’t care! Get rid of it!”

Your dad continued to look. You turned your beak slightly and nuzzled his hand, your red band showing under the feathers.

“Oh, what do you have here? Something stuck around your neck?”

He gently pintched your head with two fingers and pulled your hair tie off of your neck. He looked at it closely.

“Honey, isn’t this Jessica’s hair tie?” You jumped up and down, estaticly.

“I said get rid of that bird Charlie! Their nothing but trouble.”

You started to get nervous, your mothers words ringing trough you ears. Then, another idea came to mind. You looked up to your dad and over to the fridge. You then hopped up and flew over to a photo of you, pecking at it slightly.

“AAAHHHH!!! It’s flying! Catch it!” Charlie, however, followed you to the fridge, looking at what your were pecking at. You looked at him, his eyes full of curiosity.

“Wait, why is it pecking at Jessica’s photo? Something is up. Honey, where’s Jessica?”

“I don’t know, but you need to get rid of that bird!”

“Honey, calm down. Jessica! Jessica! Come out here please!”

Everyone looked around, but of course you didn’t come. He called for you again, but again you didn’t come. Then, your father looked at you. He opened his hands flat. You landed on them and looked up at him.

“Jessica...is that you?” He asked. You tried to nod your head, but instead your whole body went up and down. In shock, your father almost opened his hands, but stopped. He looked at you again. “Did you just...nod at me.” You “nodded” again. “Honey, Jessica’s...right here...in my hands.” Your mother looked at him, complete frustration on her face.

“Don’t be silly Charlie!! That thing is just a bird! Our daughter could not possibly be it!”

“Honey, listen to me it is. Jessica, go over to your mother.”

You listened to your father. You jumped from his hands and flew over, perching on the table near her. She looked down at you, confusion filling her face.

“But but but...it’s just a bird. This can’t be Jessica! Jessica is my sweet darling, not a stupid bird! Your not my daughter, are you?”

You nodded to her, jumping up and down for good measure. Her eyes tightened, squinting at you.

“You...are my daughter? But...but. How can this be? Only yesterday you were my daughter and now...you, you, your a...bird!” She fainted on the spot, falling back in her chair.

You flew over to the counter and looked at her, chirping. Your father ran over to her with a damp cloth and held it to her head.

“Kids, go to your room. We need to talk with Jessica...”

Your two brothers looked at each other and then headed up to their room, closing the door.
124122.title: Birds of a feather stick together

1241221.content:
After what felt like an hour, your mother finally recovered, still a bit groggy.

“Oh, morning Charlie. I had such a weird dream. A bird flew into the table and it turned out to be our daughter. Crazy, right?” Then your mother looked at the table, seeing the bird again. ‘Oh god, that wasn’t a dream, w...was it?” Both you and your father shook your heads.

Once she finally calmed down again, the three of you went into the living room. You’re parents looked at you in disbelief.

“Ok, so to be sure. You are our daughter Jessica, correct?” You nodded. “Ok, so we got that covered. Hmm, so how did you get like this?”

You tried to say “I don’t know,” but only chirps came from your beak.

“Oh right, your a bird. You can’t speak. Why couldn’t you have been a parrot?” You roll your eyes at them. They were almost taken aback. “Well, I guess yes and no questions will have to do. Do you know how you got like this?”

You shook your head side to side.

“You don’t then. Well...that complicates things. Amber, do you have any ideas?”

“Ideas?! I still can’t believe my daughter is a bird! A. Bird! Besides, what do I look like, a magician?!”

You knelt down a little, saddened by your moms frustration. She saw this and brought her hand to you, petting your delicate feathers.

“I’m sorry...honey. It’ll be ok.” You nuzzle your moms hand, showing you understood.

“I’m glad to see you two have reconciled. Now, what to do with your new...body? If anyone finds out about this I don’t even know what would happen. Then again, no one could tell you were a bird, so I don’t think that shouldn’t be a problem. Still, we will have to be careful. I guess let’s just try to live with it till we can figure this out. Ok Jess?”

You lightly nodded again at both of your parents, then flew upstairs to your room to think.

This is unbelievable. One day I’m a regular, everyday teen and the next I’m a bird! A bird! Well, it could be worse. At least my family understands, although mom still seems reluctant to believe it. Now, what to do as a bird?
1241221.title: “Talking” with you parents

12412211.content:
Ooh, maybe I should going spying around the neighborhood. That could be fun, but...no, I shouldn’t be rushing this. I guess I might as well find something in here to do. Perched on your night table you look around your room. Then, a thought comes to mind.

Dad’s right, anyone looking at me would think I was just any another bird. I should really do something about that. Hmm, what though? You fly up to your vanity and jump from one end to the other, looking for something. Then, you notice a small yellow flower that blew in from earlier.

Oh, that would be fitting, now wouldn’t it? You hop over to the it and try to pick it up, only to realize you don’t have your hands. Oh yeah, don’t have my hands anymore. Um, ok, plan B. Let’s see if dad is any help.

You fly out of your room and back down to the living room, where your dad is looking at a magazine, on birds of all things. You fly around him and hover around his book to get his attention.

“Oh, a sparrow, what are you doing down here little one. Wait, no. Sorry Jessica. Kind of hard to recognize you. What do you want?”

You quickly fly upstairs, your dad following, much slower than you. You fly in your room and land by the flower.

“Boy, you sure are quick. Now, what did you want to show me?” You nod your head to the flower next to you, as if you were trying to put it on. ‘Oh, what a nice flower. If that’s all, then I’ll leave you to your things.”

Charlie turns from you and starts heading out. You “yell” to him and he looks back.

He brings it to your head and wraps it among the feathers. You look at yourself in the mirror, looking much different from any other sparrow you saw. You dad looked at you, intrigued.

“Wow honey. That is brilliant.”

“Um...Jessie. I know this is weird of me to ask but could I...look at you more closely. This is just such a big opportunity to look at a bird without it freaking out.” You looked at him inquisitively, then he responded.”No, no, never mind. Sorry to bother you.”

133222112.content: "But I want to be a snake king!" I protest, squirming in her tentacled grip. She only holds tighter, squeezing the breath from my lungs. I'm a very constricted boa constrictor! After the third time I almost slip from her clutches, the beautiful snake woman sighs, soaring in the direction of the grand palace. "If I introduce you to the king, do you promise to behave?" she asks. "Yes!" I swear. I would be crossing my fingers if I had any. The naga drops me off right in front of the throne, settling at the king's side with an air of ruffled feathers. "Your heir, Sire," she tells the Snake King as he rises to his full height. He's an anaconda, only he's larger than any I've ever heard of. He must be over a hundred feet long, with fangs as long as my whole body! I shake in my metaphorical boots. "So you have come to see me!" he says, adjusting the huge golden crown on his head with his tail. I nod once, too afraid to speak. The naga watches me with narrowed eyes, clearly displeased. "And you want to be my heir?" "Y-Yes, sir," I stutter. Unexpectedly, he laughs. "Foolish young snake! Only the biggest of idiots would chose to be my heir! You see, there is a curse upon this throne. No heir of mine can live more then a day. As soon as I declare someone my heir, their fate is set! The only way to stop it is to kill the evil wizard who lives in the tower across the valley, and who cursed me for marrying his daughter. But now, I declare you my heir, the only snake foolish enough to choose to be so. What will you do?"

Well, yeah, you panicked and fainted on the spot. You awaken to the sound of your mother calling you. As you open your eyes, you see her smiling face and her gentle nudging on your scaly arm. "Wake up, sleepy head. It's time for you to get to get up!" You stand up to try and shake your sleepiness away,only to find that your body is still that of a raptor! But the weird thing is that your mom doesn't even notice anything about your change, and even when you try to explain your sudden change, she calmly tells you that you've been her little dino baby all your life. She then proceeds downstairs telling you that breakfast is ready.

         As you walk downstairs, you see a huge slab of meat on a plate, and your mother telling you to hurry up and eat your food. Now that you think about it,you are rather hungry. You rush over to the table and begin eating the food,devouring it in only a matter of minutes. You immediately tell your mom that you're done and ask what day it is. (Yeah, you forgot what day it is.) She tells you it's saturday, so you silently thank the heavens you don't have to go to school today and risk getting teased or feared or whatever by the student body. But now that you think about that, your own mom didn't even so much as flinch when she saw you. Maybe it's the same for everyone else? But you do remember her telling you you've been her baby dino for your whole life, which means she can see that you've transformed. You're not very sure about what to do now! Maybe you should...

You walk back up to your room and look around. There's the TV, your desktop PC, a table with paper and some pencils...You don't exactly have much in your room. You grab the remote and try to turn the TV on with it,but your claw gets stuck in the button. You pull it out and the button comes off with it. You grown and try using the computer, but you realize something...If you broke the remote just by pushing the buttons...Better not try the keyboard then...You pick up the pencil to try doodling, but it keeps slipping off your claws...

That's it, you try doing something downstairs this time. Video games? Nope...Fridge? You've already eaten this morning...You could try asking mom to turn on the TV for you? Oh well...When she turns it on, you plop down on the floor in front of it as you watch some nature documentary about fungi or something. After a few minutes in, you yawn and ask mom to change the channel. Old cartoons? Seen it...A movie? You saw that a week ago...Another documentary? Wait a minute, this is a history documentary about ancient creatures...Might as well take a look at it.

It's mostly about herbivores before our time, but it eventually goes to velociraptors, which is what you turned into! You listen intently to find out more about what kind of creatures you've turned into. "Velociraptors are carnivorous dinosaurs that, unlike other carnivorous dinosaurs, hunt in packs. They have a long claw on each foot, which they use to tear their prey apart after a kill..." Ugh, this is all just about their behavior! You wanted to know more about the things they CAN do! Like how fast they can run or something...You finally get up and tell your mom you don't wanna watch TV anymore. As she turns it off, she suggests calling some friends from school and tells you how popular you are, being the only dinosaur in your school. You're a bit confused about that last part. Does that mean reality changed so you were really born as a dinosaur and lived your life like this ever since? You just go along with it and look for your list of friends' phone numbers in your room. When you find it, you see a picture album just barely peeking out under the covers of your bed...
1351112.title: In the house, you're BORED!

13511122.content:
You grab the album and place it on top of the desk. You carefully open the first page to see a much younger-looking mother holding what appears to be a large egg. The next few pictures show a small baby dinosaur in the park, eating dog food, and blowing out birthday candles. "Alright, this is getting kinda weird for me." you say to yourself. You flip the page and see a slightly bigger velociraptor in what appears to be a preschool class picture. he was at the very center with the closest children placing their hands on him. "Well, I guess mom was right about me being popular..." The next showed him, mom and dad in what must be their vacation to the mountains. "Didn't I break my arm back then?" Another flip of the page showed the raptor sitting on a hospital bed with a cast on his arm. "Wow...All the memories I have as a human all fit in here." The next picture showed what must've been his admission out of the hospital, as the picture showed him being carried in his father's arms.

The next several pages showed exactly everything that you can remember in your human memories. Your first baseball game, your little sister being born, everything was here! As you close the photo album, you look at the clock, which reads 12 noon. "Huh. Looks like I've been looking at pictures longer than I thought." You go down the stairs and see the whole family preparing for lunch around the table. Your little sister greets you and gives you a hug. You hug back and ask what's for lunch.

"Uh... yeah. Wait..." URP! Another flash of fire. "Yeah Im done." you say.

"Very well then, I am here to propose an alliance." their leader says. "You will have more riches then the world can imagine and the very world will shake under our wrath."

"Uh hu, first off you seem to know about what is going on so here is a question and I hope you will answer in the act of mutual friendship. IS THIS PERMANENT??" You yell.

"Well... I don't really... Wait you don't want to be a dragon?" a murmur goes through the group. "When we realized what was happening we all chose something powerful... YOU DON'T KNOW. but how could you not know..." They then form a circle and start whispering.

You could overhear them if you wanted to because seriously they are giants and its not like they could whisper. even then several thoughts are running through your mind.
I chose my new body. Is Everyone else changing? AM I EVER GOING TO LEARN HOW TO FLY?

The circle break and the leader steps up "We thought you were someone else. First I apologize for the rock. Had I known you were not the person I thought you were, I would not of thrown it." Yeah right, If I could hurl rocks that large at random flying things I would totally do that... "But my offer still stands. Join us, and perhaps we could both learn something about what is going on."

Hmm.... what to do? He seems to know more than me. Or he is bluffing. Or he is being used...

What to do...

1531111.content:
"I will agree to your alliance for now. But should you do anything that I don't want to happen. Well consider yourself toast." you say as dark smoke travels out your nose in a most foreboding way.

"Wouldn't dream of it" the leader replies. "Shall we leave, there is someone that I think we should both meet."

"Ok, but no more rocks." you respond.

"WAIT"

You know that voice.

You turn around to see Pegasus drops from the sky. On his back is a dog and the weirdest looking cat you have ever seen.

"Don't trust them, they just want to use you!" The dog yelps.

......... I would say I'm dreaming again but that would be an understatement. For the time this dream has been painful and confusing. I had the strangest belief that it was only going to get worst.

"James, I don't know how to say this to you."

"Let me guess you are my father" you say in a mocking tone.

"To put it simply. Yes" oh yeah it just got worst.

"And let me guess the Pegasus is mom, and the cat is my sister. These hill giants work for some crazy guy who started this whole thing, in an attempt to conquer the world. But his plan were foiled and now everyone is changing into some legendary beast. So now we have to set it right before the world tears itself apart."

"WHAT? NO. First off the Pegasus is your sister can't you tell. Second I have no clue who those hill giants work for, I just think they are bad because come on hill giants are always evil."

"He does have a point. Why did we choose to be hill giants?" one giant pipes in. Two others quickly slam several heavy rocks on him.

"So you don't know whether they are evil or not but you still assume they are using me." I ask.

"Yes"

"You too have no clue on what is going on?"

"Yes"

"And you are positive that you have the right dragon and you are truly my father"

"Yes... NO... Maybe"

"THIS IS ENOUGH" Screams the leader. "THIS DOG THING HAS SPOKEN ENOUGH LIES. Quickly James join with me, and crush these pretenders. They lie through their teeth. They offer no truth. Men, rid us of these pretenders."

"Not so fast" a strong commanding voice exclaims as a centaur, a griffin, and a phoenix come out of nowhere. "James, this is Mike, when you and I were ten we got lost in the woods together so we sat around asking each other what we would like to be. Do you remember what I chose?" the centaur asked.

"Yeah you said you wanted to be a cen.... oh." yeah, when do I sign the sheet for the crazy institution.

A fight quickly breaks out. Both sides seem to be equal. Only you can tip the balence...

Ještě několikrát mávneš téměř znecitlivělými křídly, přitiskneš je k tělu a spustíš se střemhlav skrze mraky. Kolem tebe se míhají obrovské masy vodní páry, nehmotné ostrohy zkroucené vzdušnými víry a nekonečné mlžné splazy. Jak to že lidi nejímá závrať když jim nad hlavou plachtí celá pohoří? Chvíli kolem tebe není nic než miliardy svištících, chladných kapiček vody a náhle vše jako mávnutím kouzelného proutku zmizí a pod tebou zasvitne pestrobarevný koláč světa. Roztáhneš křídla. překvapeně zamrkáš, když do nich narazí mocná masa vzduchu, ale ty jsi silný a dokážeš je z vypětím všech sil udržet ve vodorovné poloze. Kdybys neměl prokřehlé blány, asi bys úpěl bolestí. Ozve se tlumené burácení trhaného zvuku a střemhlavý pád pomalu přechází do klouzavého letu. Tady pod mraky je o něco tepleji. Navíc slunce se pomalu dere stále víš a je čím dál tím víc teplejší. Do křídel se ti zase vrací cit. Spolu s ním ti zakručí v břiše. Jako by se tě ten nenasytný orgán uštěpačně zeptal: Tak co teď?
Jednou budeš muset přistát. Už teď začínáš pociťovat mírnou únavu. A ať poletíš kamkoliv, vždy narazíš na lidi. Jsou všude rozlezlí jako švábi.

Na mysli ti vytane reakce rodičů. Takhle tě nejspíš přivítají všichni, alespoň všichni kteří mají v hlavě jen kousek rozumu. Jistě jsou na světě i tací, kteří, když před ně vyskočí, na savaně z vysoké trávy, lev, zůstanou stát a kulivše oči začnou říkat věty typu: ó jak vznešený tvor! a vždycky jsem chtěl vidět lva zevnitř. Ale něco ti říká že takové štěstí na přátele mít nebudeš. To spíš omdlí, zpanikaří nebo si vzpomenou na flintu pod postelí. Jenže třeba by jim nějak dovedeš říct...
Říct! Hlas! Slova! To jediné čím se lidé rozeznají od zvířat! Otevřeš tlamu a pokoušíš se cokoliv říct, ale z krku ti vychází jen vrčení, chrčení a pískání.
Kdepak, nikdo ti neuvěří.
Co teď? Co teď?

153222222222221.content:
You wake up slowly, eyes still shut as you snuggle in deeper into your blankets. The blanket on top of you is thick and blubbery, smelling of sea water, making you feel at home and comforted. It's so much better to be in the ocean, but for now the pelt would do.

...Wait, what?

You open your eyes, sitting up slowly and staring down at the pelt in your arms. It was big enough to cover you from head to toe, and you scurried to stand. You couldn't bear to let go of it as you rushed to the mirror, seeing a female. Not that you weren't a woman before, of course. She just looked... different.

Her skin was a grey-green color, and she had short, chocolate brown hair that reminded you of mud. But, like, really good looking mud. It was thickly clumped into strands, looking grossly oily and wet. She had light, pale yellow eyes, as well, with slit pupils. The irises almost filled up her entire sclera. Once you opened your mouth, your reflection shown sharp teeth, reminding you of a shark.

You quickly moved your pelt - ah, no, the pelt - around your front to look it over in your reflection as well. It was a soft brown, lighter than her - your hair, with white-grey spots littering it. Even with how thick it was as you held it against you, you could see the curves of your body. Or lack thereof.

You had a lithe form with small breasts and slim thighs, but you had a swimmer's muscles. You couldn't complain, really. It just felt so natural to be so optimized for water. You also noticed your chest protruding out even more than usual. Not in the form of breasts, but your ribcage was bigger.

Somehow, you knew your lungs were bigger as well.

The first plan of action, though, was to get something in your parched body, for sure, you thought as you opened your bedroom door. You felt lucky that your parents were rarely ever home, especially now considering they were on a vacation out of town for their anniversary. This left you home alone.

At night you grew anxious, closing all the blinds and curtains, so currently you didn't really need to worry about your neighbors seeing you as you poured some water from the pitcher in the fridge, never once letting go of your-THE pelt. The cold it spread through your body as you drank it made you feel like you were back in the sea and comforted once again.

Wait... what? Shoot, this thing might be messing with your head. Either way, you had another choice of what to do.
153222222222221.title: Sea Witch

15322222222222221.content:
Silence.

A single snowflake danced down to the frozen earth, melting upon it's touch. As if suddenly called by the wind that blew it's chilly breath through the rickety bare branches of the hibernating trees, a snowstorm began to fall, covering the world with the soft, icy, white cushion of silence. Utter peace in the night. Unbroken.

Imagine a town. An ordinary town covered in a blanket of snow and quiet. Not a single breath of air to be heard from its sleeping residents. Imagine a window, frost climbing up at its glass as the temperature crawls down. Inside is an ordinary bedroom and on the bed is an ordinary looking girl. The room is warm and cosy from a job well done by the central heating but a cold aura surrounds the girl. Wisps of condensation, cold air meets hot, curled from the girl's mouth as she breathed in and out. Her skin seemed to grow paler to match the untouched whiteness of the newly fallen snow and her platinum blond hair turn white. Her eyes snapped open from her slumber and revealed blue eyes of chipped ice.

Jennifer felt different. It was too hot, too warm. It felt wrong. She pulled the covers from her bed and wrapped her baby blue dressing gown around her as she got out of bed. She felt bright and new and powerful. The very tips of her fingers and the ends of her hairs felt charged. She had never felt so alive... and confused. What on earth had been in her food? What was wrong, what was different?
She walked over to her window and looked out onto the newly settled snow. Excitement bubbled in her chest as she watched it dance and twirl in front of her eyes like will-o'-the-wisps, mesmerising. She had to get out there.

She went downstairs and stepped out barefooted into the crisp snow. She felt the cold but it wasn't as extreme to her as it should have been, and it didn't bother her anyway. It felt normal. It felt right. As though she had finally taken her first step into the world in her truest form. The blizzard twisted around her like tiny fireflies engulfing her in a swirling swarm of ice. It was deep in the night, the time where there is no-one around, everyone lost in the world of dreams. No-one to see her disappear when a gust of wind dispersed the swarm into the night.

She was one with winter. She could feel the tickling of frost growing up the surfaces of trees, windows, walls. She could feel the slowed heartbeats of hibernating animals. Part of her was panicking, what the hell was going on?! Why was she so calm?
She felt an energy source in the snow, in the middle of town, in a dark alleyway. Jennifer instinctively moved towards it and took her physical form again. Curled up in snow and newspaper was a boy, blue lipped and shivering violently. He was obviously homeless. She could feel his life-force clinging on by a thread. The other, colder part of her was hungry. All it would take was a little tug at that string and it would be hers. It scared her...
15322222222222221.title: Yuki Onna...Lady of the snow...

153222222222222211.content:
He lay there in his tattered and grimy clothes, his woolly hat half covering his face as the snow settled on him, winter’s innocent victim, frosting his features. And yet the boy still did not move other than his helpless, violent shaking. She knelt beside him, white hair brushing over her face. He looked the same age as her and yet they were in totally different worlds. She’d had a normal life with everything she needed given to her. No tragedies, no hardships. Who knows what this boy had to go through on a daily basis, let alone what had brought or driven him to live and freeze on the streets. Pity for the boy overwhelmed the hating hunger of the colder part of her. She knew she couldn’t just leave him… not now!

She didn’t understand what all these strange things were and why they were happening but she knew that she had some sort of control over them. She had felt winter itself, after all. She stroked his face oh so tenderly, willing for the cold to let go, willing for every chill that needled into his body to reverse, come back and repair its damage. She was not going to let him be cold tonight.

* * *

He always knew he was hanging on by the tips of his fingers. Just surviving. From the time he ran he knew. Charlie had never had it easy. He felt the dread that night when he heard it was going to be a very cold night, like feeling his fingertips slipping slowly. He felt it when it was getting late and he couldn’t find anywhere to shelter from the cold. There were no warm doorways, no abandoned houses, no bus shelters. So he did what he could. He huddled up in an alley; never the best place to go, but there was nowhere else. He wrapped himself up with the heat-conserving newspaper and hoped for the best. It was all he could do.

He felt the stabbing cold like daggers even as he slept. They seemed to claw down his flesh and suck away his will and energy. Not even the newspaper could shield him. He felt himself slipping…
And then it stopped.

The daggers were pulling back, leaving blessed warmth which spread through him with a feathery touch. He could feel life and strength gently re-entering his body. He opened his eyes in slow motion and saw an angel. Purest white in the falling snowflakes as she disappeared like snow on the breath of the wind. He sat up and looked around. There were no footsteps, no sign but a mere memory that she was there. The only certainty was that she was gone.
153222222222222211.title: She knelt down and touched him softly...

15322222222222222211.content:
How can this happen? I'm a Hydra?! They aren't even supposed to exist!

"Jake? Is everything alright sweetie?" asked a voice.

The doorknob began to turn and it slightly opened.

Oh no!

My mom entered my room dressed in her nightgown. She took one look and screamed.

"Mom wait! It's me Jake!" I tried to say, but it came out as a growl. My mom freaked out and ran out the door. I heard her fumble for something in the hallway and I heard her ran back in. She was holding the replica of a Samuri sword my dad bought.

I thought she said that was too dangerous for a decoration...

My mom held it upright and slowly approached me. "T-Tell m-me w-where my J-Jake is!" she stammered.

"Mom" I said but a growl came up again. She ran forward and swung the sword. My right head was sliced clean off. I screeched in pain as I turned. My mom sliced off my left head, and I collapsed from the pain. All that left was my center head. I glanced up and saw the edge of the blade near my face. It was shaking in my mothers hands.

"L-L-Last warning b-beast" she stammered. "W-Where is m-my J-Jake...?"

I tried to say something but a low growl escaped my lips. She raised the sword up, but stopped and dropped it. I felt a tingling where my other heads used to be. I saw my old head disintegrating. I no longer felt the pain and stood up. I turned my head to see that four new heads were growing in place. I changed from a three-headed hydra to a five-headed hydra. My mother screamed and ran out the door.
15322222222222222211.title: Power of the Hydra

I managed to climb out the window, and I headed towards the deep woods. I live just on the edge of the forest, so I could hide in it. I traveled as far as my kegs would carry me. I found a cave that wasn't that noticeable and ran in. I collapsed on the ground and cried.

My own mother...my own mother attacked me. If I wasn't a hydra, then I would have been in trouble. I just have to keep out of other peoples sights, forever...

Oh no it's Melody!

Melody was my best friend since kindergarten. she always stuck up for me, but now I don't even know what would happen. Melody was heading towards my cave, and I quickly went to the back of it. Scrambling for the book to stop my becoming a dog
15322222222222222222221.content:
Yard sales and garage sales were for me great fun, but the Edsel estate sale changed my life and the way I look at my future. What can someone so young afford when attending an estate sale, the answer to this is old books. Old decrepit looking books, the kind someone would set up high on a shelf to keep it from becoming dust laden. Books of broken spines, deteriorated covers, as such one book I saw dealt with devils, magic, and... curses.

I bid five dollars for the book and was surprised when I quickly won the bid for it, as I clutched it to my chest and headed home with the prize.

Once back at home the book and I went to the reading room, the bathroom where there I opened to me a realm of such devilment, it made me begin laughing hysterically.

In the first few pages were names and titles of known devils, and what they held as powers available, as well their favorite method of demeaning mankind

Next was a glossary of magical spells, many of what I read but the titles were used to change men or women into animalistic forms. I noted that just some of the magical spells specified the change was not permanent, but most were of the permanence of a terrible finality.

Lastly, the nine final pages dealt with curses, and from scanning them and their titles told me this was one section I was best to stay away from lest the curses do an about face and chase after the caster.

Returning to the glossary of magical spells, I came upon one that if read aloud, it would settle down around me to enhance it said my outlook on life and grant me a future of ever-changing luck. It sounded to a young mind as fun and rather harmless, a foolish assumption to be sure!

I did as prescribed, and using some sidewalk chalk borrowed from my sister, I drew a pentagram design on the hardwood floor in my bedroom.

Then with the book laid over my crisscrossed legs setting Indian style, I began then reading the spell, inserting my full name, my origin of birth, and did an unbelievable mistake, I wished I were a dog, a large breed, large enough for me to retain my human memories.

Imagine then my disgust for wasting five bucks on a worthless book when nothing immediately happen!

Soon it was evening supper time I ate three helpings of everything set on the table. So ravenous my manner of eating food, mom compared me to the Rottweiler dog owned by her father at his farm. Her mention of that breed of dog was to me and my spellbinding a providential directing of the spell.

After supper and feeling full I went for a walk, but the walk soon became a running experience, exhausting me, to my returning home that mom noted my tongue was lolling out my mouth but I was not stinking of sweat.

Evening television viewing seemed to bore me until early in the evening before sundown I decided and said I was going to bed.

Opening the bed covers, a warm summer night, my room being on the second floor to the house meant the air conditioning cool air never reached up to my room, so I opened the windows and laid on my bed. My mind was busy thinking, remembering all the details I ever knew about Rocky, that the name of the Rottweiler stud mutt dog owned and kept as a guard dog to the farm. Rocky doubled as a male puppy maker when the spirit moved him. I knew little of his activities other than barking when someone arrived at the farm.

Rocky was a dog of all muscle, he was huge, almost as large as was Tommy, the Shetland pony grandpa kept for his grandchildren to come there and ride.

As I lay there day-dreaming, wishing that I were like Rocky, free from school, no responsibilities, able to get up and go where I wished, his lifestyle seemed so easy and so much fun. Then it began as the sun dropped beyond the western horizon. As the night stars appeared, so did patches of dark skin and short fur. I failed to take notice of my spreading Rottweiler pelt until I felt the need to use the bathroom and doing like dad and not like sis, I stood and watched in horror as the wall behind the toilet trickled with sprayed moisture.

A sight to see and giving to my realization, I looking down saw not what was me coming out the shower that morning, but the new me, me becoming a large dog, a duplicate to Rocky!

15322222222222222222222211.content:
You woke up, feeling refreshed and... enlightened, almost. You felt your natural smirk reside on your face, walking to your bathroom to do your usual business.

Use the toilet, shower, brush your teeth, then go downstairs. You didn't realize how all your senses seemed to be heightened, the sound of your feet hitting cold floors, the smell of your usual deodorant, the taste of morning still clinging to your tongue, the bright lights of the bathroom having just a little less color. Yellow and red just looked green to you, considering the yellow and red dotted beach towel on your floor now just a pure shade of dark green.

You went through everything the same way until you ran the water, hands sliding over your body. Something didn't feel right.

The body wash went over flawless soft skin, no muscles to be seen yet still felt, as if illusioned away. Your hands felt dainty and small, with sharpened nails that were longer than usual. You had slightly widened hips, as well, but only just barely. Your face was perfectly androgynous in shape, as well.

Your hands reached your back, feeling the sensitive base of your tails, and you felt sudden panic. Tails?

You jumped out of the shower, still wet, yet landed with amazing grace and poise. In the mirror you saw it.

Canine, green eyes (actually yellow), green hair (actually orange, but just a red tinted yellow), and pointed fox ears just over your head.

Curse not only your sudden colorblindness, but also your sudden change!
15322222222222222222222211.title: Ani
