15322222222222222222222222.content:
Yard sales and garage sales were for me great fun, but the Edsel estate sale changed my life and the way I look at my future. What can someone so young afford when attending an estate sale, the answer to this is old books. Old decrepit looking books, the kind someone would set up high on a shelf to keep it from becoming dust laden. Books of broken spines, deteriorated covers, as such one book I saw dealt with devils, magic, and... curses.

I bid five dollars for the book and was surprised when I quickly won the bid for it, as I clutched it to my chest and headed home with the prize.

Once back at home the book and I went to the reading room, the bathroom where there I opened to me a realm of such devilment, it made me begin laughing hysterically.

In the first few pages were names and titles of known devils, and what they held as powers available, as well their favorite method of demeaning mankind

Next was a glossary of magical spells, many of what I read but the titles were used to change men or women into animalistic forms. I noted that just some of the magical spells specified the change was not permanent, but most were of the permanence of a terrible finality.

Lastly, the nine final pages dealt with curses, and from scanning them and their titles told me this was one section I was best to stay away from lest the curses do an about face and chase after the caster.

Returning to the glossary of magical spells, I came upon one that if read aloud, it would settle down around me to enhance it said my outlook on life and grant me a future of ever-changing luck. It sounded to a young mind as fun and rather harmless, a foolish assumption to be sure!

I did as prescribed, and using some sidewalk chalk borrowed from my sister, I drew a pentagram design on the hardwood floor in my bedroom.

Then with the book laid over my crisscrossed legs setting Indian style, I began then reading the spell, inserting my full name, my origin of birth, and did an unbelievable mistake, I wished I were an animal, a large breed, large enough for me to retain my human memories.

Imagine then my disgust for wasting five bucks on a worthless book when nothing immediately happen!

We all joined hands at supper and father said grace, as I finished the first course the telephone rang. Father got up from the table and answered the phone, he became very excited, slamming the receiver down hard on its cradle, as he pointed at me and told me to come with him.

In the rush to get outside and running along down the driveway to the country road what was out front our house, father told me that Bernard had broken loose and farmer John called, asking us to try and catch as hold the aged Belgium draft horse.

We were each to one side of the narrow gravel topped road when there came Bernard, he having slowed to a easy trotting, was closer then to my side of the road. Bernard knew me, as I was there when he was born and helped to feed him after his mare died due to complications from the birthing. Bernard and I became good friends, and I got to ride him bareback, something he would not allow anyone else to get away with doing.

Bernard saw me he slowed and halted before me, we greeting each the other, me talking to him and he sniffing my scents, my breath, and nuzzling his head at my chest. Grabbing his reins I grabbed a handful of mane and swung myself up as onto his broad back. Father smiled at me with a sense of admiration of his son, as I turned Bernard around and with a nudge to his flanks I urged him to trot toward where he had his home.

When we arrived there stood a smiling farmer John and in his hand was a twenty dollar bill, my reward for the capture of his prize winning draft horse stud.

What happened next became a personal feud as to the reality of what happened to me. As I trotted Bernard up the grassy driveway to the farmhouse and my reward, Mister John came up to stand and take hold the head halter on Bernard, as he looking up at me said, "If by the powers that be there was a way that Bernard and his abilities could own the commonsense of you his friend!"

No sooner said than as I sat there leaning forward and giving Bernard a love hug about his broad as strong neck my view of the world began to fade. As did my ability to see the world in colors Ii knew, as changed to dimmer hues, as an increased sense of smell did more to suggest what was or was not worthy a choice for food or a friendship. My spell and the fond wish said by farmer John merged, and merged me with Bernard, we being on body and mind then as one and alive!

Without similar realizations, the feeling of merging, becoming then as is a strong horse and quite matured is to a young person something of a wild ride at a circus of sensations. Suddenly I felt the ground from hoofs set hard in place. I felt his tail, it dubbed short, whisking, tickling. Ears twitched as he too realized he had gained an increased awareness of all around him as inside of him. We were as one animal, alive and each knowing of the presence of the other and being as friends, we remained as friends, as each gained and learned to enjoy feelings differently.

My clothing was returned home and the twenty dollar bill still inside my shirt pocket. I stayed at the farm, Bernard entering a corral, we walked and communicated through mutual thoughts blending and enlightening. The excitement and a couple miles of trotting as the returning home to the farm had rise to various bodily needs, we then took a long drink from a watering trough as Bernard raised his head and whinnied a sense of our delight.

After a long while of us trotting about the corral, raising a cloud of dust, Misses John appeared and clipping a rein to our head halter, she led us inside the barn and into the large box stall where Bernard thought of it as his home. We stood there as he watching and me inside him attesting to feelings I would not admit to thinking or finding enjoyable, we waited for the inevitable visit by father to find his lost son.
15322222222222222222222222.title: A wished wish gone haywire

choices: Hi Dad, as how, who, and what...
Dad and farmer John, yet both fainted...
153222222222222222222222221.content:
"How, I cannot imagine of what happened and if it was because of me? What did I say but, as Bernard stood there on my grassy driveway, as I took hold my hand gripping the head halter on Bernard, our eyes met, as I said aloud a wish, "If by the powers that be, there was a way that Bernard and his abilities, could own the commonsense of you his friend!" As then did your son fade, he slipping down, around the belly of my horse, and physical merged the two of them together as if of one body.

Please hear me, as what has happened to you fine boy is the God's truth. I was the one witness to this strange happening, believe me Sir." Said farmer John as an angered father stood there not knowing what to say, it was Bernard who whinnied and broke the sullen mood.

Pawing his left forehoof at the gravel portion to the driveway, and making use with the large hoof, as scrawling there in the dirt, the horse wrote, "HI DAD."
153222222222222222222222221.title: Where oh where has he gone

choices: Horse sense and alive in a horse...
1532222222222222222222222212.content:
"Great, that worked well, don't you think so too there Bernard?"

There, lying on the ground laid farmer John and almost beside him was dear dad, they having watched with a sense of horror as with some guidance, as a learned human ability did with a hoof wrote a greeting from a elatedly happy son to his dear father, if just to inform him his son was alive and well.

As Bernard being his calm and aged self looked at the green grasses there outside the fence what made him its captive, he lowered his head and began munching at the lawn. Needless maybe to say, but his added entity, a boy having become as is a horse, did not resist, and wishing to experience all of what was Bernard his pal, he let the animal take full control.

It was after several minutes while grazing that Bernard and pal noted first the movements and awakening of Dad.

Dad whirled around and seeing Bernard as standing there grazing peacefully, he got up and went to help farmer John to awaken to bear as well the truth of a strange situation.

"Are you alright?" Dad asked of his and our farmer neighbor.

"Yea," replied Farmer John, he then shaking the cobwebs from out his head, turned and looked at us, his prize winning stud horse.

"I got to think about this some more, do you mind if I leave and go home, this is something I cannot begin to explain to my misses." Dad said, as Farmer John nodded his head as to agree.

We watched while munching a mouthful of grass as Dad walked down the driveway and staggered twice as he was assuredly distracted by his strange realization of my/our experience of merging.

"Come now Bernard..., a friend, as maybe you could with time, inform me as what I did to you, or you did to..., oh nuts!" Farmer John said as he took hold of our head halter and led us back to the corral gate. As the old farmer opened the gate, Bernard offered a shrill whinny as if he and we were disgusted for having to enter the dusty corral.

We, Bernard and I entered the corral and we spun our bulky big horse body around as Bernard offered his owner and master another defiant whinny.

"Be calm dear friend," I thinking communicating with my host horse self. "As now we here, you can begin to show me as let me gain the knowledge of what you are being a horse."

Bernard snuffled his breath as to agree and we began trotting along side the fence surrounding that corral area.
1532222222222222222222222212.title: Dad and farmer John, yet both fainted...

15322222222222222222222222121.content:
Reading adventures was one of my delights, but becoming bodily merged into the body and mind of a mature stallion is like entering the Twilight zone, only for real. Every move Bernard made was echoed back to me and my mentality. His very basic thought patterns were along the lines of what he either smelled, tasted, or as touched.

Instinct is just what it implies, as a smell enters the nostrils and is passed through the sinus Bernard reacts to varied stinking smells. Unlike a dog or cat that from their bodies being extremely agile, what they often tend to sniff or lick is not what my pal Bernard goes after. As of what Bernard would lowering his head and mouth to taste what smelled in a robust manner, the flavor of it striking my mentality communicated my displeasure causing a short lived argument.

Our being touched came from many origins, the windy breezes were often using the mane hair or tail hairs to tickling, making Bernard to shake his neck or flick his tail. It was a warm day when first I became in part a second entity merged with Bernard. The occasional dust devil of rotating dirt and wind did sandblast what was non-fur covered skin, tending to dry what was warm and sweaty.

Although one that first day and afternoon we, Bernard and I stood alone in a corral while waiting on my dad to return with whatever he could do or would allow about me being in part as a mature horse. Bernard had memories of both fond and spiteful times when mares touched his body. His mind reacted to how he was touched, causing various reactions, as other than his tail swishing the reactions were along the same lines as how humans might feel when touched.

That afternoon became a long waiting for Dad to return, as dusk came and then nightfall and no dad coming, we saw Farmer John come toward us and he snapping a rein to our head halter, we were led to a barn stall for our first night being as one.

Bernard seemed quite thrilled with his being put, placed into the stall holding his scent. Although he was more than thrilled and showing it to Farmer John, his new partner in life was smelling what to a human, no matter if young or old, the stall, stank!

Then came the usual as expected evening ration of mixed grains poured into a steel bucket snugly bound by a rope to the inner side of the stall door. Bernard was quick to licking, lap up the hard kernels of raw grains, a mix of rye, oats, and barley. Bernard and then myself, we knew that to him the grain was part of his welcomed evening meal. A thick square of hay placed into a crib made for hay fodder offered bernard something for him to munch, eating at it until a later hour or two.

Finally, it was very dark and we could see only because of the dim golden light beaming to illuminate the rear yard area behind the farmhouse and the front of the barn. I was a bit surprised as how well at night Bernard could see what was in the barn. He might see some movement or a sound heard, a scent sniffed, causing him to turn as stand and stare, he being very scared of the dark and from our thoughts I learned of his fears.

Farmer John owned four mares he entered into the state fair for load pulling, and judged as to their pedigree breed, how they stand and look being an asset to their kind. Even in the dark, Bernard knew his stablemates were close and via whinnies they communicated, reassuring one and another that they were safe from harm or attack.

When we felt each our own sense of being weary, Bernard folded down his forelegs and then tucked under his barrel-body those strong hind legs, did we lie down and slowly let sleep take us to dreaming what a horse and stallion has to dream, dreams.
15322222222222222222222222121.title: Horse sense and alive in a horse...

choices: My sister Sally arrives with my book of magic..
153222222222222222222222221211.content:
The coming of light beaming into the barn windows was like an alarm clock to Bernard as we noticing the increased amount of light bade him to scramble his strong legs and we rose up to our comfortable four legged stance.

Just as we stirred about in the boxed stall, the four other horses there is their stalls stirred awake and rose to standing. It was a new awakening for me, as totally unlike my usual manner of rising in the morning I was taught to tend to do thingings, as an example of brushing my teeth, comb my hair, wash my face and put on clean underwear in case for some reason I needed to go to the hospital my underwear would look presentable; or so mom said that clean undies was very important.

Being then as a horse, Bernard was an animal and to him my thoughts about taught human hygiene almost got him to give me a horse laugh.

"Really Bernard, my friend, if you were me and not as you a horse, if by being human there are many requirements, nurturing like mares do for their foals that being human one does to be accepted by other people as of good breeding." I said, as Bernard seemed to understand more of about my thoughts, as if my mentality and his was still. merging.

Bernard did not reply with use of words as he by then and even with me aboard inside him we had not merged our memories to such an extent that he knew how to speak his mind. He would do things as to mark his responses for me to then understand him and his limited abilities to express his ideas.

"Ah ha," we both had the say thought when hearing first as then seeing farmer John walking toward, as entering the barn, he there to feed and give water to his horses.

That morning would be the first of many future mornings as my time being joined, merged into Bernard was to last a while longer than even I expected. Farmer John noticed something about Bernard as he looked different, and the farmer stood gawking at us for several minutes of weird suspense.

"I can't believe it, its impossible, Bernard you look like your old as much younger self this morning, as to how I can only imagine the merging of Steve has caused a revitalization!

Oh, and a good morning to you Steve, as your parents know as do I that you are inside with Bernard as part of him.

Your dad called me late last night, he found in your room the chalk drawn pentagram you had drawn on your bedroom floor, and there to was a book. The book being a dictionary of magical spells, curses, and the like. I requested of him, your father as not to destroy the book but being it to me, as my late aunt was big into magic and taught me to respect it.

I might from the book discover a method to returning you to be your human self, would you like that?" Farmer John said as asked, he talking at Bernard but directing his spoken words to me and with a hope I understood what he had said.

I whinnied my response as being there and Farmer John then smiled, he satisfied that his words had got to me and I was still alive being me but in with Bernard. As Mister John the farm owner began his morning rituals of feeding and serving up clean fresh water for our morning drinking, I was to learn that instincts of personal hygiene meant nothing to being a horse. As what made and had its own scenting was to Bernard as something what made him pleased and feel contentment, such that people think of as more vile and quickly discard as make it go away.

Farmer John led the mares out the barn and put each into the front pasture, it being very green and the grasses there were a foot tall. Bernard thought it odd that he, we were not given the opportunity to join the mares, as he had dark masculine ideas floating around in his primal mind as what he wished to do that day.

Farmer John then came back into the barn and he standing outside the wood and iron bar door to the stall, he said, "This morning I plan to have the veterinarian come and check on you, you being Bernard my horse and with you Steven, as something has happened during the night. Bernard, his body has rejuvenated muscle wise, he, as your body looks similar to what he did several years ago.

I am not sure, but maybe due to your use of magic and merging with Bernard that you brought upon him the biblically stated expected life expectancy of three score and ten years. That is my logic about what happened as of how sleek and healthy he looks this morning. If so, and you Steve being a teenager and a healthy and athletic young person, what was you must have done this... rejuvenating of Bernard. That said and if what I think happened is true, then you by being merged with my prize winning stud stallion, you both could live a life together for some sixty years!"

As to what Farmer John said did nothing to give Bernard a thrill, but to me, I understood what Mister John said, and the realization of me remaining for all my lifetime as being a horse, an animal seemed undesirable, as if a curse.
153222222222222222222222221211.title: Rising with the sunshine...

choices: Two stomps is an ask to stay...
1532222222222222222222222212112.content:
"Well, hello there little girl, and who may I ask are you?" Farmer John asked, he never having met Sally, she the younger sister to Steve.

"Hi, I am Sally, the sister to Steve, could I see him, please?" Sally asked, as just then Mrs. John walked out the back door of her house, she seeing a pretty red haired girl with freckles, and she lugging with her a large volume size book.

Mr. and Mrs. John both motioned to where Bernard was, and as Sally marched toward the barn the old couple followed, if just to see what the young girl would say when she saw what her brother became.

Bernard and Steve saw Sally arrive and then come toward them as they stood quite together there in that big boxed stall.

As then Sally entered the barn, she saw the upper half of what was Bernard peering down at her. "Steve, I have your book here, father told me to take the thing to you. S-t-e-v-e..., are you here, answer me, father said that you were a horse, but I told him that was silly, where are you, Steve?" Sally standing there at the entrance to the barn was acting quite nervous as she said, "I saw the pentagram you drew on your bedroom floor, as if from whatever you did, something burned a charred mark into the floor.

Bernard then snorted, and stepped closer to that side of his stall, as Sally backed up and stood staring at the tall and big draft size horse.

"Steve is unable to answer you, he merged with Bernard, they are one in the same, being as a horse." Mr. John said, as Sally turned her head a offered him a scowled look as if he were telling her a big story.

Sally was a bold girl, and she having heard what Farmer John told her, she walked directly up to the large wood and iron bar door, and unlatching it, with her shoulder she rolled the heavy door back, allowing her entrance into the stall.

"Steven are you really inside this big horse, do something to say if what Farmer John said about you is true?" Sally asked, as Bernard allowed Steve to do whatever he wished, and with raising his left fore hoof, he did slam (Wham) it down hard unto the wooden planked barn floor.

The harsh hoof stomp seemed to scare Sally, but she composed herself quickly and looking up at Bernard, she said, "Neat trick, but if you are inside this horse, stomp that same hoof two times and then wait a moment and do it one more time."

No sooner had Sally asked and Bernard the big horse did exactly as she requested he do, and then she smiled up at the horse.

"Wow, but Steve is it fun being a horse, and your so big! Oh I remember you came here often to help tend to Bernard after his mom died. If you can could you stomp your left fore hoof once for replying as a yes answer and twice for a no answer?" Sally said, as she saw then farmer John walk around the corner of the boxed stall and stand then in the open doorway.

Bernard then stomped one time using his left front hoof onto the wooden planked barn floor.

"Hey neat, wait until I tell my friends...," Sally said, she thinking to boast about what happened to her older brother Steve.

"Wham-slam-wham," Bernard tromped his left front hoof twice very hard as to signify to Sally as Steve telling an unequivocal, "NO!"

"Oh, is this supposed to be a secret? I wonder then why father has talked with our minister, and called a few of our uncles, he telling them that his son had gotten himself as damned.

I do not think you are damned, I hope not, Steve may I pet you?" Sally said, she having said enough to cause Steve to worry and with a softer front left hoof he stomped as to allow Sally to pet his, or Bernard's horse body.

Steve began to think about the spell he put upon himself, and of what Farmer John did to wish a double the power of the spell, locking Steve inside the horse body born to Bernard. Sally, being so young, not yet in her teenage years, she stepped up close the the furred chest on Bernard and began petting his muscular self.

"Bernard, Steve becareful of you sister and do not step on her feet!" Farmer John said, as he walked inside the stall, wanting to keep Sally in sight and out of harm's way.

"Steve, Steve, you are so lucky to be a horse, and such a big horse, as tall, with long legs, big hoofs, and, and... big just everywhere!" Sally said, as her petting moved from the chest on Bernard to petting his flanks. Farmer John at that moment took Sally by here left arm and hustled her out from the stall.

"That book was sent here for me to read, as my family heritage has some knowledge of doing magic. Let Mrs. John take you to our kitchen and give you some of her special butter cookies, their the best." Farmer John said, and Sally being a good girl, she followed Mrs. John into her house.

Farmer John picked up the larger than a legal volume big book, he reading the cover name, as then rolled the stall door closed. "Steve, I shall do my best and check if you can come out from being inside Bernard, as if that is what you wish?"

There was a long few minutes of no horse movement, not even the docked tail. Steve was thinking, considering, and Bernard was being a good friend and stood there waiting to see what Steve might say with a heavy hoof.
1532222222222222222222222212112.title: My sister Sally arrives with my book of magic..

choices: Phone caller has need of a sound-good stud...
15322222222222222222222222121122.content:
"Thump-ker-thump," Bernard strummed his left fore hoof twice upon the barn's wooden plank floor.

"No...?" Farmer John said, he saying as if questioning Bernard and Steve inside the big draft horse, as though he, Steve was more than happy to remain as merged into the physical self of the large horse. "Steve, boy are you in control of Bernard, did you just answer my asking if you wished to stay and be merged as a second entity-mentality as part of my prize winner draft horse and stud?

Did you read the directions and rules of the magic this book controls, I think not. As if you had read the rules you would learn that becoming an animal or merged into an animal's body like you are, that as every day passes, your chance of becoming again a person, as human, degrades, becomes less likely.

Have you given any consideration to your parents, or your dear mother, she having learned from your father as to where her son went to live is about out of her mind with fear and worry you are stuck being a horse for many years to come, like, maybe seventy years, or more.

I would think if I asked your sister if she would wish her brother should stay being a horse, that she should become upset and beg you to come out of Bernard. You could be so much more than just a pedigree stallion. Consider what it is to be a horse, the hours of dullness, of standing and waiting for me or someone else to flick the reins and move you to do work or to meet a mare.

What then of your future, of what you had some plan of becoming as your life's work, you held such promise as a young man!" Farmer John argued, as Bernard with Steve inside the equine's mind, did listen and consider.

"Ker-thump ker-thump," again Bernard thumped his left fore hoof, as specified for the present, he decided, as wished to remain merged into Bernard the horse.

Farmer John and the book of magic turned and left Steve to being as part of Bernard, the elderly man walking the length of the barn and entered his small office. He laid the big book down on his desk before he pressed the "On" button to his Keurig coffee maker, as he planned to sit and read the book of magic from cover to cover.

An hour passed, or maybe more, but Sally returned to the barn, she munching still on a butter cookie and had one in her hand with the thought of feeding it to her brother and Bernard.

"Here brother of mine, I brought you a cookie!" Sally said, she holding out her hand as open and flat for the horse lips to nibble at, and grab then the cookie.

Bernard did the munching but it was Steve who did the appreciating of the sweet as butter flavored cookie.

Sally then walked the length of the barn and she entered the business office of Farmer John. She smiled a friendly grin, and asked, "Did you find some way to changing Steve back to being again a human?"

Farmer John looked then away from the book he was reading, and with a blunt answer, he said, "No, and what is worse, Steve had Bernard thump his fore-hoof twice to specify he would prefer remaining as part of Bernard.

No matter what he said, I plan to keep looking for a way to force him, make him comply, if just for the love of his ans your mother. I did read of one possible method spell, if cast correctly, I might force him out of Bernard and meanwhile transform his past self into being partially a horse, or best a pony stallion, your brother then becoming a were-pony, I think you would like to see him be a pony no and the!"

Sally smiled then, she offering a reply, said, "Yes, oh yes I would love it if Steve became for me as a pony, why I could ride him and we could have lots of fun times together."

It happened then that the phone there in the office did ring, and Farmer John picked up the receiver, as said, "John's Farm, hello!"
15322222222222222222222222121122.title: Two stomps is an ask to stay...

choices: Sally knows just what she wants...
Mr.Kindle arrives with a huffy attitude...
153222222222222222222222221211221.content:
"Good day sir, my name is Elson Kindle and correct me if I am wrong, but some people in the horse breeder association informed me you own a excellent draft horse stud?" Asked the caller of Farmer John.

Farmer John was a bit too quick to reply as on past occasions he had leased Bernard to do the honor gifted him as being a healthy sire. "Yes, I own an excellent stud horse with remarkable conformation in the manner he carries himself whether walking or at a trot."

"Oh really, ah Mister John, Mister John you would lease Bernard for a stud with Steven going along for the ride, but really!" Said Sally, she remarking, having overheard most of the conversation, as thought to remind Farmer John that Bernard was right then as different.

"Oh wait, ah there is a temporary problem what I need to resolve before I would consider leasing Bernard. It is very difficult for me to expound as to my reasons why not at the present that my stallion would be available..., and it has nothing to do with your horse or your reputation as a breeder." Farmer John said, he taking the reminder by Sally as to her brother having merged physically with Bernard, and being along, Steven might feel awkward.

"That is telling that man," Sally said, she speaking rather loud, or enough for her voice to carry along the phone line for Mr. Kindle to hear her remark.

"Well, your attitude and that of your daughter tends to disgust me!" Mr. Kindle said, as Farmer John put his foot into his mouth when he remarked, "Oh that was Sally speaking her mind, as she is the sister to Steve and for now Bernard." No sooner had Farmer John said what the did, that Mr. Kindle was quick to suggest he wished to drive to the John's farm and have a look at Bernard.

After Mister John hung up the phone he turned to look at Sally, as he said to her, "That was both foolish a statement as it was rude, can you imagine what that man is thinking about Bernard and someone named Steve."

"Sorry," Sally said, her tone of voice showing well that her apology was real.

"OK, I accept your apology, as for your brother, I was reading through the book of spells and came across some of the rules what govern transformations and cases of merging. It reads here that the person transformed or having merged with another form, be it human or animal, their is a time limit of fourteen days to return easily back to being their self. The longer the duration of being transformed or merged, tends to decrease the likelihood of their returning to being their real self or form.

I know that I made mention of this before, but from what Steven seems to have decided, as to his wish to remain for a longer period of time being as Bernard, he is endangering his future.

Since you would be his caretaker, I suggest that you decide as to what breed pony you wish your brother to become when I make of him a Were-pony.

It reads here that of those so changed to become a Were-creature, the moon being either as full glow or partially in view works to determine the level of animal that Steven might become, whether by day being wholly an animal embodiment, or by night he would revert back to being anywhere from 40% to 70% of human form.

So then what do you think we should begin for Steven?" Farmer John said, while putting the responsibility as fully on the shoulders of a young girl and sisterto her fading brother.

info.brief_description: You wake up changing into an animal and you love it!
info.description:
The story starts off with your just an average teenager with a very boring life

Then one day you wake up as an animal! suddenly you're free from school, work curfew evreything! You go off in you new form to have adventures what ever those may be.

Here are some rules

no toilet humor

no sexual things keep evreything 13+

Other people (like friends and family) can be turned into animals and join you on your advenure too

Throw in any cartoon character cameo you want! You want to include Superman or the Powerpuff girls go ahead! (turning human toons into animals is fine even encouraged)

That aside have fun!
